review.title: Great time in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Great location.  Friendly and efficient staff.  Clean, spacious room.

review.title: Nice central hotel
review.reviewText: Nice renovated hotel but windows are thin in the corner rooms you can hear a lot of street noise most of the game
Very happy with the extremely helpful staff, location and our large, comfortable room.

review.title: Old hotel trying to sell you timeshare
review.reviewText: Came back here after 4 years for our anniversary. Definitely gone downhill! Very outdated and scrappy. Bathroom grout black, bath mat filthy, asked for room that was not facing main road but every night we heard nightclub across the alley when people spilled out at 2:00 am. Air conditioning very loud and came on at weird times. Shower was clogged and water did not drain and filled up the bath halfway before we finished. Went down to front desk and they fixed but left wet footprints everywhere! VERY pushy to get you to sit for a 120 min timeshare presentation with promises of breakfast and a $100 visa gift card. If the rooms are an indication of what the timeshare is like, I'm glad we declined albeit we had to say it strongly before they realized I was serious.Plenty of other great hotels in Union Square for the money and will be going elsewhere next time.
review.negativeRemarks: Rethink the whole "get them to buy timeshare at all costs" and pay your staff like a normal company!!

review.title: Nice spacious room close to walking distance of do
review.reviewText: It was a pleasant experience.  If breakfast was included in the price it would have been great.
review.negativeRemarks: Add breakfast in the price
review.locationRemarks: Cable car, china town and BART are nearby and within walking distance.

review.title: Decent expensive hotel, request a quiet room
review.reviewText: My first night (had a 7th floor room) wasn't a good one as the windows in the room don't seal completely (contacted maintenance he said there wasn't anything they could do except Hosng a blanket to try and squelch the noise). Don't get a room facing Post street as you want sleep unless you bring ear plugs which are the strongest against noise. There's a club across the street and the people yelling and carrying on didn't stop. Traffic noise and sirens didn't stop. I contacted hotel staff and they moved me to a quieter room the next night. They have a woman near the elevator that tries to sell you a timeshare after you check in (not cool). The cake I ordered from the Italian restaurant was just okay. Hotel comped it after my unsleepable nights there. The two takeaways are a great staff and a clean room. Although I wouldn't stay here again due to the noise problem. 2nd quieter room had weird tapping noises on wall during the night. Very odd!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff (dodged woman trying to sell timeshare)
review.negativeRemarks: See comments above (street noise in rooms)
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown was awesome. Walk through tunnel to get there.

review.title: Excellent hotel with friendly staff.
review.reviewText: The hotel is in great condition, and staff be lives in treating guests well. It is in close proximity to shopping, cable cars, museums, and more. I would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Good location but room noisy from traffic
review.reviewText: Room was spacious and in a good location very close to union station. The only complaint was it was really noisy when we were sleeping from the traffic even though we were on the eighth floor. Maybe they need better insulated Windows.

review.title: Hotel is very close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Overall the experience was fine.  Had to wait a lot for the car as there seemed to only be one person parking/getting cars.  It was 1 block off Union Square and an easy walk to China town.
review.negativeRemarks: There was a night light in the main room that was TOO bright for sleeping. It would have been nice tor there to be a exhast fan in the bathroom

review.title: I Love This Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice experience, we will always stay at the Donatello Hotel..  Very nice staff and rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: More places to eat.
review.locationRemarks: We came to San Francisco to drop my daughter off for College, did not have the time to sight see.  However, San Francisco is a beautiful place.

review.reviewText: Great hotel, large, comfortable rooms & the windows open & let the fresh Bay air in.

review.title: Excellent service
review.reviewText:
This was an excellent home-headquarters to our 6 days of touring in San Francisco.  It was easy to make our way around once we conquered the Muni system (bus/streetcar/train) and the street cars.  We challenged ourselves by walking all the way to Pier 39 several times, and it was close enough to enjoy the self-created walking tour, even!  We particularly enjoyed the advice and help from the concierge who was able to assist us with any questions we had.  Having a kitchenette in the spacious room allowed us to stop off at the nearby Walgreens to pick up food for breakfast, and to save our generous meals to have the other half the next day.  All of the staff were excellent, the rooms were super clean, the showers worked well, the towels were fluffy and the space was very useable, making us think we were at our home away from home.

Thank you for the wonderful introduction to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks:
spacious rooms
cleanliness
convenient location
helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: I cannot think of a thing!
review.locationRemarks: Enjoyed Chinatown, shopping areas, Streetcar Museum, convenient to the streetcars (although they were almost always full), easy access to Market St.

review.title: Large rooms, great location in the city.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed amenities. Location great for accessing the sites in the city.

review.title: close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and conveniently located to shops and restaurants.

review.title: The hotel is in a perfect location.
review.reviewText: The hotel was great.  I didn't know it was a Wyndham vacation property so was a little surprised about the request to attend the 2 hour presentation to obtain a $125 gift card.  Would have been curious to learn more; however, not take 2 hours out of a 48 hr. weekend in the city to get the information. Room was lovely.  Staff excellent. Also didn't realize with Expedia you pay 100% upfront for the room, but that worked out OK too.
review.negativeRemarks: If they want to sell you on the vacation property aspect of the hotel - make the hard sale presentation shorter ...people will attend.
review.locationRemarks: Explore Union Square, restaurants, shops, people watch.  Easy to get any type of transportation.

review.reviewText: This hotel had an excellent location for exploring many SF highlights like North Beach and the Ferry Building.  But I had a problem with how I was billed:  Expedia charged my credit card for the full amount at time of billing, which, in my case, meant I was paying for my entire hotel stay a month before even seeing my room.   I prefer to be billed at the time of check-in or departure.

review.title: Family in San Francisco
review.reviewText: the hotel is in excellent location, close to many shops , restaurants and places of interest walking , clean , renovated hotel rooms clean and comfortable , with kitchen , ideal traveling with children , on the top floor there is a room with coffee, tea and chocolate with very friendly staff that helps you plan your trips
review.locationRemarks: close to many shops , restaurants and places of interest walking

review.reviewText: Very good hotel in very good location, clean and very comfortable, the staff were very welcoming and gave us a reasonably early check in and Richard at the concierge was very very helpful.

review.title: Very noisy
review.reviewText: Room was nice location on corner very noisy due to traffic on city streets no noise reduction from windows. Heater/ac in room did not work! Call front desk for repair  they would have engineering reset remotely would work briefly then stop. Spent first night in cold room. After complainng again on second and last night they sent a portable heater to room.

review.title: Great room set up for family.
review.reviewText: Corn hotel with large rooms. Loved changing area outside of bathroom. Staff very friendly and helpful.
This was a great hotel in a great location! It was clean with great service. Highly recommend!

review.title: Great Location & Spacious room
review.reviewText:
Room exactly like pictures. Within walking distance to Union square and even Chinatown.
Bed was comfortable.
Staff were helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing.

review.title: Nice location, old hotel
review.reviewText:
We stayed in a room on the 9th floor with 1 king bed and a sofa. Although the hotel was not renewed recently, the room was spacious enough for a family (2 adults, 2 children). However, the sofa bed was not comfortable enough as the king bed. There was a microwave oven and a coffee machine in the room. The fridge was empty but was ready for your own food. Hotel staff was very friendly and the lady at the front office gave us very informative clues about the city. They also have prepared a short information document to underline popular visiting sites and local eats.
But the best thing of all was the location of the hotel. It was just adjacent to the Union square, where all shopping and activities are present. As a last word, it was a good experience to stay at the Donatello hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Renovation is necessary

review.title: Nice hotel in the center of SF.Very good location.
review.reviewText: Perfect location for walking city center tours. Public transportation nearby. Rooms large and equipped with kitchen facilities.
review.locationRemarks: sightseen, shopping

review.reviewText:
Pros: The room is great. We had the deluxe room and it included a kitchenette and plenty of space. 

Cons: There was some noise coming from the street, it seems to be something common in San Francisco as you can see in other reviews.

review.title: Spacious, well-located 2 night stay
review.reviewText: We found the room to be, for four of us (two adults, two teens) to be spacious and comfortable.  There was enough room to spread out, and the fact that we had a microwave, fridge and all basic kitchen supplies (even including a bottle opener) was super.  Included in our rate we had access to the Club Level, which afforded us use of the gym, sauna, spa, coffee/tea area and the beautiful deck on that level.  We were made to feel welcome and felt that the location was great - a LOT of restaurants and shopping in the area.

review.title: Nice hotel, many ammenities, good location.
review.reviewText: Very positive. Hotel room exceptional. Short stay but memorable.

review.title: Nice hotel at great location
review.reviewText: We were greeted by friendly staff. The room was big and could easily accommodate 3 adults.  It is near union square and China town.  Uber to Fishman's wharf only costs us $7 plus which was almost the same as taking a bus for 3 persons.  It is also near Powell BART station which we also took the BART to Hayward to visit my university. Overall great experience.
review.positiveRemarks: We like the location best.  The room is also big for 3 persons.
review.locationRemarks: Union square and China town for shopping and dining.  Also worth to pay a visit to the cable car museum.

review.title: great location; cool "club" room
review.reviewText:
Got a great deal at the Donatello Hotel - definitely worth the money and the Club room was great because it had free coffee and hot chocolate and tea - perfect for warming up after being out in the crisp cold weather of SF.
Perfect location, and the room was neat and large enough for our family of 4.
The timeshare presentation saleslady was a little annoying, but they weren't overly pushy when we ultimately decided that we didn't want to waste 2 hours listening to the presentation, even though we could have gotten a 2 night stay and $50 gift card.
review.positiveRemarks: awesome location, staff was nice, room was nice, and free hot cocoa and coffee in the club room.
review.locationRemarks: super close and convenient location to Union Square

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Room is clean, location is great and staffs are kind.
I absolutely loved this hotel. Near everything. Super safe area of town.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: It was a good experience, totally I would come back anytime
Hade a great stay at the Donatello and in San Francisco

review.title: A room like a suite
review.reviewText: We often stay in San Francisco for a week at a time.   so small rooms can be claustrophobic.   The Donatello has nice, large rooms with kitchenettes, sofas, desks, plenty of drawer and closet space.  You don't feel cramped.   It's on the small side so staff is more attentive.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi is free (great), but not the strongest.   You can write this about virtually all hotels in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: It's a block from Union Square, epicenter of San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The Donatella Hotel provides a safe environment in a busy downtown arena. The rooms are spacious for the square footage. The parking arrangements are convenient and affordable. The staff is friendly but be aware, it is a time-share location so the concierge is not truly a concierge, but rather a sales person with little knowledge of the surrounding area.
review.negativeRemarks: The Concierge(s) did a polite job of informing us about the time share option but provided false information with regard to transportation and events.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near Union Square. Lots of high quality shopping, restaurants, and within 15 minutes via cable car, bus, or taxi to the Wharf.

review.title: Excellent location. Very spacious room.
review.reviewText: Bell staff,front desk, and concierge were wonderful. Unfortunately, the Shell Vacation people were time share vultures and rude and condescending and fake. If it wasn't for them, the hotel stay would have been perfect. The room was wonderful but more detail was needed in cleaning the shower before arrival. The room was so spacious for San Francisco. The location was excellent. The outside noise at all hours was a bit annoying.
Great stay. Great location and friendly staff. Highly recommended.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent Hotel.  Very clean, comform and very near to every attractions and transportations

review.title: Noisy Hotel
review.reviewText:
We purchase this as a package through Expedia and had no idea that by staying at this hotel we would be required to attend a 3 hour timeshare seminar. We went to San Francisco for our anniversary and it was quite upsetting when we got there to find out that the morning of our anniversary would be spent listening to a sales pitch. So much for the breakfast in bed.

Secondly I realize that this hotel is in a major city and there would be noise involved but because it is a timeshare owners hotel those of us who weren't timeshare owners were placed on the lowest room floor which made for an extremely noisy 3 nights. I can't imagine that the rooms on the higher floors don't have sound proof windows.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel staff was friendly and helpful
review.negativeRemarks: It should be advertised as a timeshare seminar requirement to stay here
review.locationRemarks: Great location in the heart of the city, all major attractions within a few miles

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: The Donatello is located in Union Square close to many restaurants and Entertainment venues. The bus from Fisherman Wharf stops right outside the hotel. The rooms were nice, staff was friendly and we weren't pressured by the vacation club staff. I'd stay here again
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located. Theatres and clubs are very close to the hotel.

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at the Donatello. They let us checking in early, room was clean and spacious, the concierge was very helpful in things to do, eat and go in SF. Definitely will recommend to family and friends.

review.title: Great location giving you a lot of options.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was  extremely nice and very helpful and gave great suggestions and places to try out
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are very comfortable make you feel like a home away from home
review.locationRemarks: Took advantage of all of the eateries and go shopping

review.title: Better than expected
review.reviewText: Overall, it was a good experience.  The location was good for the price, I thought.  Everything was as advertised.  The room felt large to me, with a couch and footstools.  I did not expect the fridge, microwave, and dishes in the room which was a nice way to save on food costs.  The tv in bathroom was unexpected too, though we didn't use it.  Having a dvd player in the room was a great idea too.  The hotel has some DVDs that you can rent for free, but not a very large collection.  The wifi in the rooms seemed decent.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was great.  Having a microwave, fridge, and dishes helped us lower our costs on food.
review.negativeRemarks: Felt a bit pushed into signing up for their vacation club breakfast presentation.
review.locationRemarks: Just a couple of blocks from Union Square, which is a common spot for the bus tours.  Also, trolleys are near-by.

review.title: Modern functional rooms off Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location, modern rooms, great overall experience especially with the baby. Open spacious rooms with movable ottomans and sectional, good for crib. Great Samsung TV (rare for hotel).
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms are very spacious and functional, modern like an Aloft. Excellent for baby,  ottomans can be moved around, also microwave fridge and wet bar.
review.locationRemarks: Most central location in San Francisco, close to Union Square and pretty much everything.

review.title: Centric and home welcoming
review.reviewText: Very close to the heart of Union Square, nice stores to do shopping and lost of nice bars and restaurants, elegant! Simply is a San Francisco clasic. Everybody was kind and resolving of the guests needs!

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location close to Union Square. Room was spacious, comfortable, and modern. There's even a TV in the bathroom! The only thing that could be better is the hot tub. It's inside between the men and women's locker rooms. If it was outside it would be perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: Hot tub
review.locationRemarks: Union square

review.title: very central, WiFi very poor
review.reviewText:
The hotel is a block from Union Square, very central in a safe area and few blocks from the Powell Street BART station.
I was at room 606. The room is  big, king size bed and a sofa-bed, that was not made even though the reservation was for 3 people. The staff was fast and they came up within minutes. The bathroom is small, getting old.
There is a kitchen area with a tiny sink, a microwave and a mini-fridge, with plenty of counter space, with a coffee maker and dishes, utensils and cups for 4 people.
The AC/heating is a unit on the ceiling, a bit noisy.
The Hotel premises are nice and there is live music some days.
Only real issue: the WiFi was horrible: extremely slow, the signal was theoretically good but the transmission speed was dial-up style. We used 3 different Laptops and 2 mobile phones and had to use the cellular data to download  few files. When We mentioned this to the Desk, they told us to call the IT support!
review.negativeRemarks: The WiFi needs serious work
review.locationRemarks: Cable Car 2 blocks away, plenty of restaurants and lounges

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Great location! Easy to walk to everything. Very comfortable and large rooms - just perfect.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel within walking distance of major city attractions. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The bed and pillows were comfortable as was the rest of the room as well.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very convenient location.  The staff are very friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was huge and very clean.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to everything.  Walking distance to the Bart and Muni station.  Lots of great shopping close by.

review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and in a convenient location. The staff was lovely--I had a wonderful stay.

review.title: Very nice hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Selected this hotel based on prior reviews. Property operates as a vacation club but if you see it listed on Internet partner sites it's because they have rooms to fill. After check in they will want you to talk to a timeshare coordinator but the message is short and you don't need to participate in any presentation if you care to do so. Hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The concierge Peter on the Club floor ( no extra charge to go up there) had a lot of good info and directions to share.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were very spacious. They all have sofas and beverage bar area along with king size beds. So nice to not always have to sit on the bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom a little small if two are trying to get ready at the same time but storage great if you are the type who likes to fully unpack your suitcase.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square where all the shops are located. ChinaTown is a short walk away. We used BART to get from the San Fran airport; Powell St

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 7 nights and it was perfect. The kitchenette in the room was ideal if you didn't want to eat out all the time. Spotlessly clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Very large rooms with a kitchenette, nice lounge and roof terrace for the club grade rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Entrance is rather dated, could do with a make over.
review.locationRemarks: In the middle of everything. I would certainly stay there again if i go back to SF.

review.title: NICE LOCATION , CLOSE TO UNION SQUARE.
review.reviewText: THE HOTEL HAS A VERY NICE LOCATION, THE STAFF IS VERY FRIENDLY. THE ROOMS HAVE A GOOD SIZE AND CONFORT.
review.negativeRemarks: DECORATION
review.locationRemarks: NICE LOCATION, UNION SQUARE, THE BEST FOR SHOPPING.

review.title: Nice hotel if you don't need to sleep
review.reviewText: Everything about the hotel was great, except the fact that the room is extremely noisy. You can hear everything that is going on outside, especially banging music until 3am both nights. Barely slept. Other than that the room was nice and so were the other areas in the hotel. Very nice staff. They should really invest in soundproof windows though. That kind of noise in a quality hotel such as this is inexcusable.

review.title: Great location, nice hotel
review.reviewText: It's next to the union square. The staff are very friendly and there's a nice rooftop with complementary tea/coffee. The room is good size and clean. In the weekends you could hear noise from outside but I didn't mind

review.title: 8 minute walk from Moscone Center
review.reviewText: Very pleased with the room, the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff.  Free coffee in the Club room was excellent.  The location is convenient for walking to the Moscone center as long as it's not raining.  A bit noisy in that part of the city.

review.title: Perfect location! Affordable and roomy and clean.
review.reviewText: Staff were really nice and accomodating. Fast service. I like the fact that they have a 'lounge' on the top floor where you can smoke outside and they served free coffee, tea, hot chocolate etc. Only complaint is the water pressure in the shower room. Overall, very satisfied and happy with our stay at Donnatello. Will definetely come back again at this place! Highly recommended!
review.positiveRemarks: Roomy and clean room at reasonable price. Perfect location! Lots of places to eat around the area. Friendly staff and fast service!
review.negativeRemarks: The water pressure in the shower.
review.locationRemarks: Really close to everything.

review.title: Great hotel. Big rooms.Highly recommend
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Big rooms.  Club lounge on 15th floor with complimentary coffee and tea from 7 am-10 pm
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms a bit older
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of everything, but not noisy.

review.title: Great hotel, great room, great location!
review.reviewText:
the day we checked out, we overslept (I'm sure it's happened to everyone) and at 1pm I called down to see if we could have an extension until 2 to check out. The woman who answered the phone said that checkout time was noon and that they did need the room so we should check out as soon as possible.
We did get ourselves together as quickly as possible, and by 1:45 were down in the lobby checking out. The woman who was processing our check-out sounded like the same woman who had answered the phone when I had called down, she was very nice and professional... then a guy standing behind the counter a little way down from us decided to chime in, he said "I just want to tell you that since you checked out late, we could charge you for a whole other day!" and then he went on to say "You didn't call to ask for late check-out until 1:00, when you want to late check-out you have to request that in the morning!" I told him that yes, I knew I didn't call down until 1:00, he didn't need to remind me what time I had called down. He then said it again: "You didn't call down until 1! We need that room, it's now 2:00 pm, and we could charge you for another night! I just want you to know that!"
Why that person felt the need to chime in, I don't know... but it was incredibly rude, unprofessional, and unnecessary.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, and except for the behavior of the guy when we checked out, the staff was excellent and welcoming.
review.negativeRemarks: The guy in the lobby who scolded us as we were leaving should consider a career that doesn't include dealing with the public.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is a block from Union Square, a few blocks from Market Street and the Westfield Centre -- excellent location!

review.reviewText: Fantastic stay in a great location. The Hotel staff was of  the most accommodating I've experienced.

review.title: 40th Anniversary Stay
review.reviewText: We had a great weekend at the Donatello Hotel! Everyone was very kind helpful and went way beyond to help us celebrate.   If we could just shut down Ruby Skye the club across the way. It ruins getting any sleep at all!!!! The drummer was in the middle of the street pounding away atv2in the morning and nothing is done . . . . . My husband and I just looked at each other an said, "Welcome to SF!!!!!  Thank you for making our weekend special but there really needs to be an ordinance for excessive noise past midnight.
review.positiveRemarks: The food and service at the restaurant was very elegant. We loved the room and our view . . . . Next time maybe we will bring earplugs!
review.negativeRemarks: The neighboring night club could be much more conciderate. . . . . .
review.locationRemarks: Well we hiked up Nob Hill to Grace Cathedral, and the cable car museum, over to Powell to get on cable cars, ate at Sears fine foods and the Tonga Roo

review.title: Great Union Square location.
review.reviewText: Close to shopping, restaurants, buses, and a trolley stop. The room was spacious for San Fransisco and the windows opened. The staff was helpful and let my daughter and I know which area of town to avoid, which was helpful we ended up walking everywhere. To the wharf, China Town, and North Beach for dinner. One helpful hint is the hotel entrance isn't on the street map quest has it on.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was perfect and we felt comfortable going out at night. A lot of people were out walking to dinner.
review.negativeRemarks: The blinds in the room didn't work well and had to put a pillow on the window so the rooms across the street couldn't see in.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great took the bus six miles to The Cliff House, no transfers needed to get there, which helped us, we leave in a rural area.

review.title: Awesome and relaxing stay!
review.reviewText: Very comfortable bed! We slept so well! The room was spacious, modern and comfortable! Staff are very friendly. Great hotel!! So close to union square and cable car!

review.title: Excellent location.
review.reviewText: Close to all places of interest, including many, many shopping opportunities

review.title: It was great
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the hotel but I am upset with Expedia

review.title: Great hotel in Union square
review.reviewText:
This could be one of the best experiences I've had in SF. And I come here a lot. Maybe about 8-10 times per year.  Location is great. anything you could need for a 3 day weekend is about a 3 min walk away. Transportation, Powell St., Walgreens, bus stop right downstairs. The hotel staff were friendly for the most part. I didn't really like how the concierge was trying to sell a future vacation seconds after checking in. Wasn't really ready for that. The gym was lacking. But the real star is the room. The room was really big for SF standards (there is just so much space!) the TV was modern and worked really well (tv in the bathroom too), and there was a DVD player. The bed was comfy and met expectations.. Also hotel staff came and cleaned the room every day that we stayed.

Another downside is if you stay on the weekend, the club across the street can get very loud. But that just comes with planning to vacation in a city.

review.title: centrally located near Union Square
review.reviewText: The staff from the bellmen, valet parking attendant, front desk and more were all very helpful. As well, if you were interested in purchasing a membership, information was available there as well.
review.negativeRemarks: room maid service didn't show up until after 3 pm
review.locationRemarks: Shop, eat, theater.

review.title: Stay at Donatello
review.reviewText: Great hotel!  Friendly staff and awesome bar!  The bartender was one of the best around!  The room was so large and the bed was beyond comfortable.  The bathroom had a TV in it, which was cool.  I did not like the way we had to flush the toilet using the handle, like the ones you see in a public restroom.  They gave you popcorn daily which was such a plus!  Also, GREAT location!  We were about a block from union square and a hop, skip and jump from multiple great restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Toilet and the shower water.  It was hot then cold for the entire span of the shower
review.locationRemarks: About a block away from union square and multiple fantastic restaurants.

review.title: Nice hotel in a nice location
review.reviewText: Old hotel with nice rooms.  Friendly staff, but extremely unjustified high prices for room service.  The room was very cold all the time.  Make the experience unpleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was very cold and room service charges like those of a 5 stars plus  hotel without the quality to match.
review.locationRemarks: Nice location near theaters and Union Square.

review.title: Location is good as is close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
Like the hotel location n front staff are helpful.
Only minus point is car park. Overall is good

review.title: Nice hotel, walking distance to everything.
review.reviewText: First time in the area and the hotel was close to everything we wanted to do. Easy to catch a cable car or bus from this location. Walking distance to the Ferry building and so much more. Room was very nice and modern. All the amenities you could want. Our only complain was that we got a room facing the city, so the noise at night was a little annoying. I suggest getting a room with no city view, the traffic and noise doesn't die down till about 1 am.
I had very good experience at Donatello. It was clean and safe. Especially i enjoyed the walking distance to shopping, transportation, and conference center.

review.title: Nice !! Just where we wanted to be
review.reviewText: Wonderful!! Rooms were great hotel staff awesome !!

review.title: Business Trip to SF
review.reviewText:
Clean hotel, centrally located
Gauged you on price since was busy convention week for computer industry
The amount we paid to stay was ridiculous
Work out room very small but usually empty
Staff pleasant and helpful
review.locationRemarks: It's in the heart of downtown SF so everything is nearby including tons of homeless on the street (quite different from NYC).

review.title: Excellent place
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff!  We were travelling for the Nike women's half and this place was a perfect location to all the race activities.

review.title: I can't rate it as a 3.5 because it was a 5 star!!
review.reviewText: Everyone was absolutely wonderful! It was a very busy weekend for the city with the Nike Half Marathon and the entire staff was accommodating, helpful and so very nice. The rooms were clean and comfortable and exactly what we were looking for as far as accommodations and especially location. This will be our go to hotel when staying in the city.
review.negativeRemarks: When we were there only 1 elevator was working, but even then the wait for it was not long at all and we were even offered champagne while we waited!
review.locationRemarks: So much shopping and food it was hard to decide! Only 1 block from the cable car route as well.

review.title: Property needs to be updated
review.reviewText: Front desk employee was great but handed us over to another employee who tried to sell us a time share, not a good sign. Even though the room was spacious and had a flat screen the bathroom was in desperate need of an update. While we were the there one of the two elevators broke down and has not been repaired by the time we left. Maid service did not clean the bathroom, sweep floor, etc. Unless the property is remodeled, I would not stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Train maid service, modernize rooms and keep equipment running.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We found the stay at the Donatello to be enjoyable. The check in was easy, the staff helpful and informative. The room was very comfortable and the kitchen area was useful. Having a refrigerator, microwave, and utensils was helpful.  The hotel was clean and in good shape. Location was great, close to shopping, restaurants, the cable cars, and other transportation. Walking distance to Chinatown, SOMA, and even North Beach. We ate at the restaurant our first night and the food was very good. I had read complaints about the noise outside, and the first night there was some, but it was not a problem, and for the rest of our 6 day stay I could not hear anything. Considering the hotel is in Union Square, one should expect some noise. We started and ended each day with coffee and tea from the clubhouse. I used the workout facilities once and while it was a small area, the equipment was in good shape. When I had a problem signing into the wi-fi with my laptop, the staff was helpful in solving the problem (which was my laptop, not the wifi). We would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the kitchen facilities, the free Wi-Fi, the coffee and tea until 10 at the clubhouse, the wine and cheese party, and the workout room.
review.negativeRemarks: The wifi was not strong enough to stream video, and some snacks in the clubhouse would have been appreciated.
review.locationRemarks: Close to good restaurants and shopping. Easy to get transportation to all areas of San Francisco. Felt safe walking outside.

review.title: Best Location for Union Square, transport
review.reviewText: Really comfortable rooms, lots of space. Everything you need in a hotel. Only complaint was you could here a lot of street noise but it didn't keep us awake at night.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed, Great for families, very child friendly furniture!
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shopping, dining and easy access to buses and tours.

review.title: Nice clean hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
Booked this hotel for a family of four with two teenage kids. The location was very convenient only a block from Union Square, and close to transportation (Cable Car, Bus lines, Muni). We had been in San Francisco before and had taken cable cars, so we focused on the more economical and less crowded busses this time. We took the 30 bus, two blocks away, to Coit Tower, the Wharf area, Chinatown, and Little Italy. We took the 5 bus to Golden Gate park where we rented Segways from Electric Tour Company (highly recommended). Plenty of restaurant choices nearby. Since the hotel doesn't include a breakfast we tried Pinecrest Diner (one block away) the first day and loved it so much we went there every morning through our visit. This facility is part of the Shell timeshare network and they offer rooms to timeshare guests as well as standard hotel guests. When we checked in, we were directed to a timeshare salesperson; very friendly, but not so pushy that we couldn't easily say no, and we weren't approached again during our stay.
The room itself had a king bed and a queen sofabed. It was quite spacious, clean and fully appointed. Only complaint was some street noise at night that we were able to hear from the 6th floor room facing Post street. The concierge on the top floor club was very friendly and very helpful. Complimentary tea, coffee and hot chocolate at the club lounge was a very nice touch as well.
All-in-all, this was a nice, economical, convenient base for our SF visit.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, Modern, Fully Appointed, Convenient Location
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proof the windows.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located, convenient to transportation, lots of restaurant options, plenty of shopping.

review.title: Good location in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice overall. One elevator was broken during our stay so that caused some delays getting to and from our room each day. The gym is very small - once 4 people get in there, it is too crowded. The location is great, near Union Square. This is a timeshare building so you will get invited to a "hard sell" ownership meeting. If you want the perks, or are interested in timeshare, then, by all means, go. The staff was very nice. If you are not interested, then decline after you check in and are given the spiel by the hospitality staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the size of the room - for a city room, it was quite roomy.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators and the whole timeshare thing.
review.locationRemarks: Right near the Powell-Hyde cable car turnaround and a mall. Easy access to a BART and MUNI station, which we used without difficulty.

review.title: Good hotel very well placed
review.reviewText: I went with muy daughters and we had a very good time thou we were near every place with good transfers and near the cable car

review.title: Friendly Hotel
review.reviewText:
Nice friendly hotel 1 block from Union Sq near the bus tours , shops restaurants and cafes.
Rooms big and clean and had a kitchenette.
review.negativeRemarks: Offer Breakfast

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is great, one block from Union Square, there are restaurants, cafe, stores, rent cars very close.  The rooms are big, clean and modern.  I love my stay at the Donatello.

review.title: Central hotel near Union Square.
review.reviewText: Stayed here for 3 nights. Rooms were spacious and clean. Valet parking was useful. Didn't eat in the hotel restaurant. Useful to have some crockery etc in  the room. Only down side for us was the checking in process. We had had a long drive and wanted a cold drink and a shower. Instead we were passed to a lady who was trying to 'sell' us a timeshare I think. She was quite affronted when we turned down her offer for a free breakfast talk. We were on holiday from the UK with two kids. This was not appropriate for us. Would have been more receptive if we had been offered a drink and some where to sit perhaps. She did however tell us where we could buy tickets for public transport which was useful.
review.negativeRemarks: Arrival process
review.locationRemarks: Used buses to get about. Cable cars were fun but busy. Try the one on California street which seemed quieter. Did the Alcatraz night tour.

review.reviewText: The location was great but they don't have breakfast at the hotel they only serve coffee for free

review.title: Pleasantly surprised.
review.reviewText: We checked into The Donatello late at night with 2 tired children. We got the adjoining rooms we asked for and they were HUGE with lovely decor and comfy beds. The kids were especially impressed with the TV built into the bathroom mirror. SF was cold and rainy but we saw all the sights and it was lovely to get back to our rooms late at night and we appreciated all the amenities.....thanks so much
review.negativeRemarks: All great..nothing we can think of.....
review.locationRemarks: In Union Square, short walk to shops and trolley cars and the Big Bus stop we used for 2 of the days we were there.

review.title: Near everything!
review.reviewText: Close to all the public transportation. Great departure point to all the sights.  Shower is hard to get the right temperature and the sheets are not as silky as you would expect in a hotel.  We were in the corner unit 802. Great view on powell and main, but somewhat noisy at night.  Not recommended for light sleepers.
review.positiveRemarks: The mini kitchen and the fact that it is close to union square.
review.negativeRemarks: The sheets for newer ones.

review.title: Excellent accommodations for our family vacation.
review.reviewText: Great staff, great location, great hotel amenities, great price and a great family vacation. The Donatello is owned by Wyndham Hotels.

Excellent hotel but its across the road from a night club and was woken up every night by loud drunk people. 
On a road safety vehicles used so also woken by fire engines and police cars. 
Love having a place in the hotel where we could gather with friends and have a cuppa.

review.title: Everything was great except wifi and no pool
review.reviewText: The staff was excellent and very accommodating   Had a great stay. It is close to a lot of things one might want to do in SF. Would definitely stay there again

review.title: Pleasant hotel in heart of city
review.reviewText: This hotel was recommended to us by Californians. We weren't disappointed.location, style, room size, cleanliness and comfort were all very acceptable.   Having the Club lounge for free hot drinks was a bonus. We also enjoyed several pleasant and delicious dinners at the In house Italian restaurant, Zingari.  Would certainly stay again if in SF.
review.locationRemarks: Caught the cable cars, and the trolley cars, walked to union Square, Market Street. Had breakfasts at the Cosy Cable Car Cafe, which were delicious

review.title: The hotel is in a good location.
review.reviewText: We stayed there for three nights.  The draw backs of the hotel were very poor internet service, maid/cleaning only average. ( They omitted refilling our coffee supplies and then attempted to charge us for it.) But the biggest put off was after you checked in the clerk had you meet with the sales attendant for an opportunity to purchase into the condo time share.
review.negativeRemarks: Let your Expedia customers know it's a time share opportunity.

review.title: Nice hotel, very near Union Square.
review.reviewText:
Very well located, one block from Union Square and very comfortable rooms. Service was always ready to assist you. 
I deffinetly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great location, spacious rooms
review.reviewText:
My two sisters and I recently stayed at the Donatello, first time visit to SF. Excellent location and really spacious rooms with a separate wardrobe area and a small kitchenette. I would've liked more light in the room. Bathroom was adequate and clean.
Nice touches like the bowl of apples at reception and wine & cheese on Fridays. Concierge staff in the Club Lounge were extremely helpful and friendly to deal with. In fact ALL the staff were friendly.
I found the city street noise at night hard to get use to but that would be expected for inner city living.
We all had a great holiday and are looking forward to returning asap.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, friendly staff, large spacious rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Decor could be updated. Bath towels too new, did not absorb very well.
review.locationRemarks: 10-15 min walk to Ferry Building. Union Sq just a couple of blocks away, great shopping. Have crab bisque in Nordstrom Cafe Bistro.

review.reviewText: Nice hotel in convenient location. Rooms are large, although bathroom a bit small, but not a big deal. I would definitely stay here again.
A lovely hotel, great staff, clean, comfortable room, easy walk to all tourist spots.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, near Union Square, shops and transport.

review.title: Very friendly staff, always smiling!
review.reviewText: Early checkin was a breeze! Had to wait for a late train so the bellman held our bags after checkout to let us explore the city luggage free for a few hours. A true gem of a stay!

review.title: Area not great
review.reviewText: Hotel is not in the best area, although close to union square it is also next to tenderloin, did not always feel safe outside hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything.
review.reviewText:
We loved the rooms that was the number one selling point.
I didnt like the way they handled the complimentary chocolates (one small square) of which they wanted you to fill out a form, which probably was used for marketing. We loved the wine and cheese party on Friday but it was strange when they tried to push their novelty shirts in a formal presentation at that event.

review.title: Position perfect.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a terrific position to access Union square and is literally steps from transport to anywhere in SF. There is even a major car rental hub within a block. Service was friendly and helpful. Only concern was street noise in the room.

review.title: Everything was nice
review.reviewText: We got a room with a small kitchen and a sofa for 3 people. The room was spacious and pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was helpful, the room was clean and spacious.
review.negativeRemarks: The water pressure of the shower was not enough.
review.locationRemarks: Very conveniently located.

review.title: Very nice hotel with a great location.
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Donatello for 2 nights.  It was very spacious, clean and nicely decorated.
review.positiveRemarks: My children and I enjoyed the top floor club/lounge area.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping

review.title: Centrally located comfortable hotel.
review.reviewText: Comfortable hotel, not there much as on holiday for short time in San Francisco!
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to all San Francisco has to offer.
review.negativeRemarks: Not having the timeshare discussion as soon as you check in. Was very off putting and took the shine of the hotel somewhat. On holiday to enjoy!!

review.title: Nice hotel and close to everything
review.reviewText: I'd never been to San Francisco so choosing a hotel in the right area was difficult.  We chose Donatello based on reviews and I'm so glad we did.  The hotel is nice, very clean and the staff were quite helpful with anything we needed, especially with directions!  We ended up being able to walk everywhere we wanted to go..Union Square, Chinatown and Fisherman's Wharf.  We stayed in a room on the 9th floor and there was a jazz club across the street that was quite noisy but we were able to sleep through it.  We plan on returning and I will definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was a plus!  Tons of restaurants that surround the area if you don't want to eat at the hotel.  The rooms were large and comfy.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Market Street, Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, Alcatraz, Golden Gate Bridge are all very close and most of them walking distance.

review.title: Nice hotel right near Union square
review.reviewText:
Hotel was in perfect location, right near Union Square. Central to everything. Quick walk to BART, shopping (designer and popular), China town and some really nice restaurants. Hire a bike from next door to get you all the way around San fran at really good rates.
The hotel had a rustic feel to it in the lobby and hallways but the room seemed renovated within the last couple of years. Bed was so comfortable, huge tv and there is even a tv in the bathroom for when you shower. 
I would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Great location, very comfortable rooms, lovely sta
review.reviewText: Great hotel, loved everything about it, Central location, very friendly staff, big room

review.title: Good hotel & location, staff not so much
review.reviewText: Upon checking in, was approached by staff that was trying her hardest to push their time share program on me.  Very annoying.  After many numerous "no thank you's", she still insisted I attend a 10 minute presentation.  Finally, I said ok and just cancelled the meeting later.  Had no idea this would happen on a Expedia-endorsed hotel.  Cleaning staff had to be reminded a few times to bring towels.  To be fair, however, the TV was huge and the club house upstairs was a nice little retreating spot.  I'd go there again; would just avoid time-share lady next time.

review.title: Quick overnight to see a Concert in the City!
review.reviewText:
Everything was actually very nice, clean, and friendly!  The only downside was that the room was not very soundproof! There is ongoing construction and I at first thought that the window was open,but unfortunately it wasn't! It would be beneficial to replace the windows with new sound limiting ones. 
I would have given the overall rating a 4.5 but because of the constant noise from outside it only got a 3!
review.negativeRemarks: New soundproof windows!

review.title: So dang cool!!
review.reviewText: Awesome room with a wonderful feel. Super friendly and helpful, fun staff!

review.title: Loud  is all I can say
review.reviewText: We came here for our anniversary the room was nice but no views at all. We got no sleep at all we where on the 6th floor and can hear everything going on on the streets. I have stayed at lower star hotels and had a better night sleep. Hotel looks nice and is comfortable but get a room as high as you can so you don't hear the street noise

review.title: Great hotel with a great staff!
review.reviewText: From the outside, I wasn't expecting much but once inside, I was greeted friendly staff from the point of registration to housekeeping.  I was given a room on the 5th floor and to my surprise, there is a wonderful patio to just lounge in.  The room was clean and spacious and looked like it was recently renovated.  I even had a TV that was embedded in the mirror in the bathroom!  Overall, I had a fantastic stay and would definitely come back if there are special offers.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, my room with fridge & microwave oven, central location, a nice clubhouse with complimentary coffee/tea/hot chocolate
review.negativeRemarks: If anything, maybe better lighting.
review.locationRemarks: Very closed to Chinatown, Financial District, shopping, restaurants, transportation, Terminal near Embarcadero.

review.title: Nice Hotel-Centrally Located
review.reviewText: I didn't know what to expect heard many of hotels in the area I stayed weren't great. I was nicely surprised. Staff professional and friendly. Rooms nicely appointed. Small lobby but nice. Room service was fine. The hotel is conveniently located near Union Square, large selection of restaurants, shopping and tourist attractions. If I visit San Fran again will book with this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Disappointed that I could not get in my room until 3pm, but this was listed as their policy.
review.locationRemarks: Lots to do near by, tourist area, with many restaurants and shopping.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Just off Union Square so it is quiet yet very convenient. Although there is no breakfast in hotel there is always tea and coffee upstairs. All staff is very cordial and helpful. Will definitely stay there again. Wouldn't bother to even look at other hotels

Pros: Close to union square, Above average size rooms, quite shower close to great restaurants, cheap overnight parking, two TV's in room. 
Cons: Upon check in I was offered to attend a time share orientation, small fitness room, lots of outside (street) noise.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, great staff and location. Don't agree to the sales talk no matter what they promise. We were pressured to buy up until we got into the car to leave.

review.title: Couldn't be better
review.reviewText: Early arrival got us an upgrade which was mind-blowing.  We can't imagine that the other rooms (non-5th floor) could be too much different.  We dropped the car at SFO after checking in because a car in SF becomes expensive and public transportation is very good.  An effort is made to sell timeshares, but a firm refusal will take care of that.  A perfect finish to our California expedition.
review.locationRemarks: The Academy of Science at Golden Gate Park is most interesting and the bus ride takes you past the Victorian "painted ladies" of Haight -Ashbury.

review.title: Great location right in the center of the action.
review.reviewText: Was on the 5th floor one door down from a very busy and loud party/meeting room. Also noise from the street at all hours of the night was overwhelming and I am from Chicago so I can handle usual noise levels. Proximity to high end shopping and dining was the best part of our stay.
NOT UP TO PAST STANDARDS.POOR LIGHTING IN ROOMS, POOR HOUSEKEEPING,NOT ENOUGHLINENS,HAD TO ASK FOR CHANGE OF SHEETS.HAVING TO  PAY FOR ROOM COFFE OFFENSIVE. 3O + YEAR  CUSTOMER.
review.negativeRemarks: READ ABOVE COMPLAINTS
review.locationRemarks: EXCELLENT LOCATION

review.reviewText: It was so noisy when we stayed there over the weekend.

review.title: Close to all major tourist attractions.
review.reviewText: Great hotel, only downside was the external noise. The noise from the night club a few doors down did not help.

review.title: Great location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel exceeded expectations. Large clean rooms and friendly staff.

review.title: Easy parking
review.reviewText: It was a great experience starting with the ease of parking right in the hotel.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our room was spacious and clean and overlooked Kearney street for a fun city view.  Close to union square and lots of great bars and restaurants.  Mortons is my favorite. I would stay at the Donatello again!
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby and hallways could be spruced up a bit.

review.title: Great stay in a great location
review.reviewText:
It was my boyfriend and my first time staying in a hotel together in San Francisco, but will definitely not be our last. Just a few blocks from union square and Westfield mall this hotel is located close to everything and if not, it's easy to get public transportation. We had a corner room on the 8th floor and it was great. The high ceilings are really nice and make the room feel like a studio apartment. The bed was super comfy. Only thing it would be nice to include a small sponge and dish soap as the room did have dishes and a sink. 

It was very noisy at night but we slept with the windows open. Close them up and turn on the a/c and you'll be fine. 
The staff was ok whole getting checked in. They didn't have a very welcoming or people person type of personalities, but check out was a 180. I didn't get the gentle mans name, but he was very nice and let us leave our luggage until it was time for us to go home which was a great thing. 

We will definitely consider this place the next time we come into town.

review.title: Great Hotel, very friendly staff
review.reviewText: Purpose of travel, wife and I were celebrating our 15th wedding anniversary, Great Location, just a couple blocks away from Union square and the shopping mall nearby, a lot of convenient restaurants. We were in the middle of a severe storm and power was out in large part of the city, staff was very accommodating helping a lot of people with luggage at the stairs. I will definitely stay again at de Donatello
review.positiveRemarks: Bathroom look a little outdated, decoration wise, very clean
review.locationRemarks: Tour the city, close to union square, shopping malls, China town

review.reviewText: We always enjoy the Donatello, because of the large comfortable rooms and the convenient location.
review.negativeRemarks: Please supply small packets of coffee in the room every day.

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: This was second time at the Donatello Hotel, it was clean, pleasant helpful staff, no problems and would stay there again
review.negativeRemarks: Lower rates a bit
review.locationRemarks: It was in heart or theatre  district, great Blues club  and Jazz restaurants just up the street.  20 Minute walk to the Ballpark.

review.reviewText: This was a great hotel, easy walk to Union Square, theaters and restaurants.  We didn't have a car, but the hotel did have a parking garage which is a huge plus if we come back to the city for another visit.  Very nice rooms, with king size bed, large couch and mini-fridge and counter space for take out meals.

review.title: Highly recommend!
review.reviewText:
When my two daughters and I arrived, we were pleasantly greeted by Steve. He checked us in quickly and gave us information about the hotel. We also met sweet Pam who was helpful during our entire trip! The room was gorgeous - modern decor and very spacious, with a refrigerator, and an awesome TV built into the mirror, and the terrace was a pleasant surprise. We checked in the night the Giants won the World Series and we enjoyed hearing the town erupt in celebration when the winning fly ball was caught. Although we are not Giants fans, the enthusiasm was infectious. The staff told us we were only a few blocks from the celebration and told us how to get there. I am sure the celebration kept other visitors awake, but the noise was not the fault of the staff and I could not believe they were having to field complaints about the noise from hotel guests. 

Overall, I give the Donatello an excellent rating because of the beautiful room, amazing staff and convenient location. Would love the chance to visit again - but for much longer! San Francisco was awesome and staying at the Donatello made it even more enjoyable!
review.positiveRemarks: Size and decor of room; convenient location; friendly and helpful staff;
review.negativeRemarks: Eliminate timeshare presentation - but it is what it is.You don't have to attend.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located within a reasonable walking distance to the transit center, restaurants and stores (although we did not have time to shop).

review.title: Nice hotel in great location
review.reviewText: nice comfortable hotel with very good services. staff very helpful on best way to go about touring area; driving directions;etc - not just all about hotel itself
review.positiveRemarks: excellent location for touring SF & great helpful staff
review.locationRemarks: prime location - close by to Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf ; in heart of Union Suare

review.title: Minutes away from Union Square.
review.reviewText: Great stay. Rooms big enough for 3 people. Around corner from Union Square. Lots of lovely places to eat. Staff very helpful especially Jesus the concierge.

review.title: Nice hotel in a perfect location
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days during halloween week and the Giant's win.  The hotel is right in the Union Square area which has a lot of restaurants and shopping.   The hotel was within 5 min walking distance to The Bart transportation system as well as buses, taxi's.  We used Uber (get Uber app) for transport a lot.  Cheaper than taxi's, cleaner and more private than the buses.  The hotel was in great condition.  It was clean, spacious and with a beautiful view of the busy streets below.  With it being in a central location, you will hear the street noise and people below at night but it does slow down.  We had two windows that would open.  Nice to get some fresh air.  The bed was very comfortable. There was a big flat screen tv that you could face towards the bed or the humongous stylish pull out couch. The only thing that I felt that was missing in the room was just another mirror.  There was one mirror in the bathroom but it just didn't suffice.  This will obviously not keep us from coming back.  The staff was were very nice and helpful with tourist questions and arranging transportation and leisure activities.
review.negativeRemarks: Another mirror
review.locationRemarks: Pinecrest diner for breakfast (b) (yummy waffles, french toast, eggs and hashbrowns), Levi's store, Lori's Diner (b), Dottie's (b), Brenda's(b)

review.title: Very comfortable hotel in central location
review.reviewText: I stayed here for 4 nights and would really recommend it. Rooms are large, comfortable, clean and bright. The location is fantastic - just off Union Square and about 10 minutes walk from Chinatown. Staff are very polite and helpful and always on hand to answer any questions you have.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, friendliness of staff, comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: I can't think of anything

review.title: The Donatello is a great hotel.
review.reviewText: The staff at this hotel more than very helpful. Every day they would see you and call you by your name and ask if every thing was fine. The Club Room staff would ask what were your plans for that day and give you helpful tips...best time to go there or if another function was happening also at that time, They had a list of very nice local restaurants that were fine, and the hotel has a nice restaurant and lounge also.
review.positiveRemarks: hotel staff and location were great for me
review.negativeRemarks: You can only get a king size bed. If another person wants to sleep seperate then they set up the sofa bed,which is only o.k.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located 1 block from Union Square, San Francisco, and is close to the trolly car and bus lines.

review.title: Great location in Union Square
review.reviewText: This was our first time to San Francisco and we chose The Donatello because of its location. The hotel is located in a great part of town, within walking distance to nice shops/restaurants and The Westerfield Centre Mall. Our room was right by the elevator but never heard any noise from outside our room or adjoining rooms. The only drawback was it was very noisy outside the hotel each night. The room was very comfortable, great size and nice TV with mini fridge/microwave. It was clean and up to date and the bed was extremely comfortable. The staff at the hotel were super friendly and made us feel at home. I highly recommend this hotel and we were very pleased with our trip to The Donatello!
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience, room size, comfortable bed and friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: The outside noise, maybe install better windows.
review.locationRemarks: Located in Union Square, shopping, restaurants, mall, cable car, hop on/hop off bus,

review.title: Great Views
review.reviewText: Had fun, the family enjoyed the views from the rooftop balcony.  A few tiny quirks but they were fixed fast.
review.positiveRemarks: Front desk staff were exceptional, fast check in, lightning fast to respond to anything. The Roof top Balcony.
review.negativeRemarks: Longer hours for the Balcony to be open. The Bar staff, Don't count tips in front of the customers and maybe someone that is a little less scattered.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of downtown, 1 block from Union square.  Lots of fantastic places to eat close. Best Cappuccino across the street. Best sushi boat 1 blk.

review.title: Good but with minor annoyances...
review.reviewText: Good hotel with a few minor annoyances.  Room is clean and spacious.  The Club House is quite a pleasing atmosphere to relax in...
review.positiveRemarks: Staffs are simply nice, courteous and helpful.  Convenient location.
review.negativeRemarks: Poor sound proofing, noise from street can be heard throughout the night.  Internet is slow.  Weak water pres and very noisy/faulty shower faucet.

review.title: Californian Holiday.
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, very central for our 5 night stay, SF is one of the best cities we have visited, lots to see and do. Would highly recommend hiring a bike to cycle the bay from Pier 39 over the Golden Gate bridge to Sausilto then catch the ferry back, we hired a tandem for my wife and I, also a bike for our daughter, fantastic day. Alcatraz night tour is a must but book before you leave home as you will not get a ticket.
review.positiveRemarks: Very central and 1 block from Union Square.......2 minute walk, very clean with friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Very thin windows which lets in lots of street noise, homeless people close by but they were no problem, this only added to the buzz of the city.
review.locationRemarks: 1 block from Union Square and cable cars etc.

review.title: Nice hotel but single pane windows
review.reviewText: Great but club across the street loud.  Stayed on 8th floor facing away from club and still noisy.  Otherwise excellent

review.title: Excellent, except it was noisy.
review.reviewText: The Donatello is in an excellent location close to Union Square and my room was large with excellent facilities.
review.negativeRemarks: As it's on a noisy corner (Mason/Post) it was difficult to get to sleep. I believe the hotel should look at installing double glazing on the windows.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square, close to the Stockton cable car and Westfield shopping centre and shops on Market.

review.title: Great San Francisco location
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our time in San Francisco.  We stayed at The Donatello for five nights and it was perfect for our family.  We were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room.  Everything in the room feels updated. Our room was towards the front of the building - some street noise but it didn't bother us much.  We were also right next to the elevator which we didn't hear - we occasionally would hear people in the hall.  It's in a great location - easy walking distance to most sites or other transportation just outside the door!  We would definitely stay here again.

review.title: The best hotel in San Francisco downtown
review.reviewText: This hotel was so comfort and also clean condition was very good. This hotel is located in main downtown, so it was very easy to reach to many shops and restaurants. Union square is one of the best place in SF.
review.locationRemarks: Union square and a lot of shopping stores and malls.

review.title: Nice area, lots of shopping and resturants.
review.reviewText: Easy check in and out, valet service was wonderful. Room on 9th floor but club accross the street was loud from 12 to 2am. Fridge and microwave was a nice convenience. Hot tub nice after walking all day, would stay again.

review.title: Great location, very large room.
review.reviewText: Girls getaway. Great location near Union Square. Close to shopping and restaurants. The staff in the lobby were exceptional. Very helpful for restaurant recommendations, directions, and generally seemed happy to be there.
review.positiveRemarks: The large size of the room, pleasant staff, location.
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing to be improved would be an update to the bathroom, a little worn and dated. The rest of the room had already been re-done.

review.title: Don't sell me timeshares
review.reviewText: I didn't realize when booking I was walking into a sales pitch to look at time shares for a free breakfast. Barf. I was on a family trip to decompress and the last thing I want as a salesmen on vacation is to be topically complimented by someone who then turns that into a pitch. More importantly I won't return because obviously this is lucrative for them as suckers prolly write checks daily to simply stop the pitches from coming. No thanks ever again.

review.title: Great hotel, one block from Union Square
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Donatello located right in downtown San Francisco this past weekend. It's conveniently just a block from Union Square and the Powell St. Cable car route. The hotel was very clean and comfortable and the staff was very accommodating and friendly. Our room was clean and included a small kitchenette and a comfortable bed. The only downside about this hotel was when we arrived the concierge associate gave us our "welcome packet" and some information about the surrounding area (good places to eat, shop, and see). However, he then proceeded to tell us about this complimentary breakfast that he hosted and in exchange for coming to this 30-60 minute meal and filling out a short survey we would also get a $100 dollar gift card. We were skeptical, but reluctantantly agreed (mainly so we could get out the door to start sightseeing because he would not take no for an answer). We showed up to the breakfast and it turned out to be a 2 hour high pressure one on one sales pitch to buy a time share. Luckily the sales woman felt bad that we were deceived into coming and said we could still enjoy the breakfast and leave whenever we finished eating. Overall this hotel and our stay was a great experience and we would recommend staying here anytime. Just the one concierge employee was our only negative experience while staying here, but it wouldn't deter us from booking another room here in the future.

review.title: Centrally located
review.reviewText: Large room with a balcony to walk out to a courtyard. Very clean and bed was comfortable. Located near tons if shopping and close to many restaurants.

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: Spent a week in the City and this hotel was the perfect location and good value. The rooms are very good.
review.positiveRemarks: Quality of furnishings and it was quiet for a city location
review.negativeRemarks: The Concierge service was poor - very friendly but the guidance was below average. I popped round the corner to The Hilton and the advice was v good

review.title: Central location, pleasant and very helpful staff!
review.reviewText: The room was large and had a small refrigerator, dishes, and a microwave. The staff graciously provided extra towels and toiletries. They gave tips about where to eat and helped with directions to get around the city. We enjoyed our stay and would be happy to return.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, roomy, big soft towels, robes, refrigerator, dishes, and microwave.
review.negativeRemarks: Be allowed to use the roof top area at night.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to restaurants, stores. transportation, & Chinatown.

review.title: Great Location Close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
We've stayed here before because it is so close to Union Square and we like that location. It has been updated and the rooms are very nice, tastefully done and comfortable. There is no view from the window, but you expect that in that area.

We were surprised that the concierge wanted us to come to a time share presentation, but we didn't want to waste precious time in the city doing that since we aren't interested. She didn't seem to know much about restaurants either.

We walk to Sears for breakfast, it's close and there's nothing available in the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice if they had a bar other than the little tiny one with the piano in it. It just seemed weird and not worth having.

review.title: Loud to stay
review.reviewText: We stayed on 8th floor at the corner room. Room condition was so nice but my husband and I couldn't sleep at all because it is too loud!!!!!!!! Barely slept 2hrs. You can hear people talking on the street and also, car. I won't go back to stay.

review.title: Love it!!!!!
review.reviewText:
I really enjoyed staying at this hotel.
Location was excellent!!!
Stuff members are so nice and kind, especially thanks to Jesus(front dest) cool name~~
N Peter was very kind telling us all the wonderful place to go to.
Unforgettable memories in SF.

review.title: Comfort, Excellent View & Awesome Location
review.reviewText: It was an awesome experience. I just went there to my honeymoon and I love it. The room was really comfortable and big, there was a sofa, desk, a king bed, microwave, mini refrigerator and a wide closet.
review.positiveRemarks: The location. Its located near to the Union Center. Its just a few block from Westfield Mall, cable car station, bike rental, cafes, and shops
review.negativeRemarks: The staff

review.title: Great hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Room and amenities were excellent. Comfortable, conveinent well kept.

review.title: policy of not cleaning rooms
review.reviewText: My room was not cleaned for days which is hotel policy, not something I knew before arrival. The room was big but drab. I gave reception some postcards and asked if they could put stamps on them and post them. They said they would be pleased to do this for me. They were posted without stamps. Two have arrived in UK, the rest unsurprisingly have not. I emailed the hotel company about these issues. No reply.
review.positiveRemarks: I will not stay in this hotel again and cannot recommend it
review.negativeRemarks: Regular and daily cleaning of rooms. responding to comments and complaints
review.locationRemarks: Good location near Union Square, but lots of beggars who can be aggressive.

review.title: Centrally located with very helpful staff
review.reviewText:
The room was large and had a shared patio
It was very clean with a second television screen inserted into the mirror in the bathroom
All the staff were very helpful indeed and the desk staff even charged my mini flick video camera as the plug in the bedroom was of insufficient voltage for that particular task

Overall enjoyed my stay there immensely and enjoyed their wonderful Italian cuisine on their first floor in house restaurant

review.title: Nice hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: The hotel recently upgraded their TVs, but were having problems in some rooms. The TV in our room did not work and we were very disappointed. Apparently, they had known about the problem for a couple days and seems to me this should have been fixed immediately. As compensation, they did not charge us for the valet parking or room service (breakfast). I would recommend this hotel if all amenities are available and in working order.
review.negativeRemarks: Repairs done in a timely manner
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square

review.reviewText: Very good. We parked the car and walked everywhere. The food at Zingara's was excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and large room with high ceilings
review.locationRemarks: Union Square shopping nearby, Macy's !!!

review.title: Vacation in San Fransisco.
review.reviewText: Most of the staff were very pleasant and helpful. Super comfy beds. Very reasonable rates for the huge lovely rooms. One block from union square, the heart of San Fransisco, close to Bart, bus us, trams, shopping centers, restaurants. My only negative experiences--- street cleaning noise and confusion about room cleaning. We had to inform the concierge if we wanted to have our room cleaned. The policy apparently is rooms are cleaned once every 4 days. But overall experience was great-- would certainly stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: It was lovely, great location, friendly and helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Guests should be informed beforehand about room cleaning policy.
review.locationRemarks: One block from union square, the heart of San Fransisco. Near the Bart, shopping center, restaurants , trams, buses. The best location ever.

review.title: Great Location and Staff
review.reviewText: Some of the nicest people I have ever met in the hotel industry are here.
review.positiveRemarks: The great staff and the location. Also, rooms were wonderful.
review.locationRemarks: Close to world class shopping, restaurants, Union Square, China Town, cable cars, Market Street, and theaters.

review.title: Good value and centrally located near Union Square
review.reviewText: The entire staff was courteous, competent, and friendly at all times....concierge Pam went out of her way to be helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Great value with no real compromises.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator carpet was just a bit worn.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located near Union Square with easy access to cable car terminal and BART Power station. Chinatown is not far away.

review.reviewText: Great hotel in terriffic shape. Beware of the neighborhood and make sure to ask for a room without a view. The corner rooms admit an inordiante amount of street noise.

review.title: Best Hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel! Great location, very nice big rooms with a refrigerator and the bathroom mirror had a TV in it. Thought I would never get my guy out of the bathroom!
review.positiveRemarks: Big room, comfy bed, refrigerator in the room that you can actually use, complementary WiFi, and very nice staff.
review.negativeRemarks: nope

review.title: "Specials" are not for you
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in an excellent location, its maintenance is fair, however WiFi connection is very slow.
When we arrived after login in into the internet, the webpage said there was a parking special throughout our stay where guests will have free parking. That was not true, at the end we were billed in full. We found that to be deceitful, after we showed it to the reception staff, he said, he could honor it because we had booked our stay through Expedia.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom needs an update

review.title: convenient location

review.negativeRemarks: offee in rooms was weak
