review.title: Nice hotel and close to everything.
review.reviewText: Staff were friendly. Rooms he plenty of space, with a fridge, microwave, couch and a work desk. Great hotel for business traveller.

review.title: Comfortable hotel well situated to Union Square
review.reviewText: No complaints other than the restaurant in the hotel is noisy and food average.
review.negativeRemarks: Cheaper price
review.locationRemarks: Lots

review.title: excellent hotel, location is perfect
review.reviewText: I recommend this hotel. the personnel is very friendly and at the same time very professional. The hotel is close to a great variety of store and nearby to the transportation facilities.
review.negativeRemarks: Expedia fail to meet my request for a room with kitchen facilities including stove. The hotel had only microwave ,sink and a small refrigerator.

review.title: Comfy and stylish location for walkers
review.reviewText:
Our 2 nights here worked very well. We were greeted warmly in the tastefully decorated lobby after a long flight & were very happy with our immaculate, spacious room (with a terrace, sitting area, in room coffee maker/refrig., lovely linens and toiletries) on the 5th floor. Lucking out with perfect weather we walked to Symphony Hall, Castro & Mission districts, Nob Hill, etc. Used to big cities -for better and worse-I must say that the homeless//addiction problems in the area (which have seem to have, sadly, increased since our last visit several years ago) had us avoiding walking much of Market St. & Civic Center areas later at night. The bar and restaurant looked attractive and had a piano player until about 10pm although we had other evening plans and missed him both nights.
Reasonably priced for this city we would stay here again if avoiding the more "touristy" areas.
Easy access to cabs and BART as well.

review.title: Great location, couple blocks from union square
review.reviewText: Great hotel in excellent location. Rooms good size with microwave, coffee maker and iron. Little bit tired looking in places, but happens to the best of us. Staff extremely friendly and helpful, we really enjoyed this hotel and would stay there the next time we go to San Fran.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the fact you had extra things to make being away from home easier eg: coffee maker, iron, clothes line in bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: Parts of hotel starting to look a bit tired.
review.locationRemarks: Couple of blocks from union square, cable car, Bart, great shopping, 7 eleven round corner. We loved the location.

review.title: City Stay
review.reviewText: The Hotel is ideally situated in the heart of San Francisco close to Union Square and is a real gem.The rooms are very spacious and well appointed with large extremely comfortable beds.The staff were eager to please with nothing being to much trouble.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Close to all amenities

review.title: In the middle of everything
review.reviewText:
Being close to Union Square gave us access to the entire city. This is a nice hotel with excellent staff and excellent appointments. What I expect for San Fan!
Mike`

review.title: Good location and comfortable room
review.reviewText: Good location, easy to get around and walk, good spacious room. Great weather (Sept). Would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Good size clean room, nice bed. Staff helpful. Club lounge for tea , coffee and quiet relax.
review.negativeRemarks: Continental breakfast only but plenty of other good options just around the corner.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square, Market St, shops, cafe's , cable car and 15 minute walk to ferry. Take the f line to Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Good central hotel

Just a block away from Union Square & the bus & cable car stops.
Nice hotel with large rooms & comfy beds even fitted in an extra sofa bed for our grown up daughter.
Cannot fault it & the price was reasonable for our 5 night stay.
Got to see all the sights and used our 3 day muni pass to the full.
review.negativeRemarks: No

review.title: Great hotel close to Union Square very convenient

review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was very clean and the staff was very accommodating.

review.title: Great location

Excellent location a block or so from Union Square. The room was big and had all you needed or wanted regarding fittings. Staff were more than helpful,nothing was too much trouble.Only downside was very noisy in the street outside early mornings, trash collecting
i think,our room was on the 6th Floor facing Post Street. However i cannot blame the Hotel for that.

review.title: Close to Union Square; loved the location!

review.title: Great hotel for couples
review.reviewText: We found all the staff very helpful and friendly, when we checked in Kelvin on reception gave us a choice of rooms. We were given a large room with windows on 2 walls with a great view over the city. We also got great help and advice from Pamela, the concierge who organised our trips for us and gave us local info on where to eat. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: The welcoming and friendly feel with great service from all the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: We don't have any.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location in the heart of the city, easy walking distance to shops, restaurants etc.

review.title: Perfect Hotel for our first visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The was our first time to San Francisco and having stayed here for 5 days we have nothing but praise for The Donatello Hotel, and can only agree with all the other reviews. Starting with the Staff everyone was so pleasant and friendly, great spacious rooms, large comfortable beds which also included coffee maker, fridge and ice maker.
The location was fantastic as we walked just about everywhere with Union Square being only one block away, we included a ball game at AT&T Park was just amazing and I would suggest that our sporting teams in New Zealand see how the fans get behind their team and how the Giants treat the fans, we went to a Monday night game which was totally sold out at 42,000.
The only down point was the WIFI was very slow. In saying that you cant match this hotel for location,staff and room quality for the money

review.title: Clean Rooms, Great location & Super helpful staff.
review.reviewText: Nice big clean rooms and some of the friendliest staff you will every meet in a hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location right next to union square, couldn't ask for any more while in San Francisco.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel in very good position and has excellent staff and facilities. Close to Union Square where most shopping is around. Plenty of places to eat and public transport close. Would highly recommend for anyone visiting San Fran.
review.negativeRemarks: none

review.title: Ideal San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText: For us the hotel was ideal. Spacious room with a large very comfy bed. The location was perfect close to cable car and the hop on hop off buses and the hotel staff we interacted with were very pleasant and helpful.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel and location. Would recommend it and will stay there in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: The spacious room, tv in the bathroom was a new feature.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Great downtown location, did not have to use our car.

review.title: Great hotel but bring your ear plugs!
review.reviewText: If you're looking for a well positioned union square hotel that's good value for money with spacious, clean and modern rooms then look no further. The Donatello was the in the perfect position, close to union square shops and dining but still an easy cable car ride to fisherman's wharf!! Now, for all the bonuses (and there is a lot) there was one big downside and that was the street noise at night!! Boy, when I say noisy, I mean noisy (all hours of the night), they REALLY need to address this situation with some double glazed windows!! Mind you, we were only on the 5th floor and facing the street, so if you book here make sure you ask for a high floor NOT facing the street! We ended up buying ear plugs on the 3rd night of our stay and I did sleep well (but that could have been from sheer exhaustion from not sleeping the first 2 nights!) All in all I would stay here again but only on the non-street side up higher!
review.positiveRemarks: Great position, very modern, spacious, well kept rooms....
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise was terrible

review.title: You'd be happy to stay here
review.reviewText:
We found the hotel lived up to the previous reviews. The meet and greet was helpful, the rooms sizeable for an inner city hotel room- pretty close to suite size Free wifi was great and the location an easy walk to shopping and the cable car. Room service food was good quality and reflected what was clearly a pretty good Italian restaurant. Only down was noise when people were talking in the corridor.... (If you have a room why not use it?).

All in all we were really happy and thoroughly recommend this as a quality but not luxurious hotel stay ideal for the longer and shorted stay
review.negativeRemarks: Corridor talking noise
review.locationRemarks: Central and handy

review.title: Good for everyone
review.reviewText: Great location, lovely rooms with a small kitchen. TV built into the bathroom mirror was a nice touch. Easy access to the BART and cable cars, the downtown bus loop has a stop outside the hotel next door . Plenty of restaurants close by, the restaurant at the hotel was excellent.
review.locationRemarks: 1 block from union square, easy to get from the airport using the BART (exit at Powell street). Also handy for the bus loops.

review.title: Loved our stay !!
review.reviewText: Staff very helpful, friendly and knowledgeable. Rooms clean and large. Jazz every night in bar. Centrally located, near restaurants, clubs, AT&T ballpark. Will definitely go back next time in San Francisco !!
review.negativeRemarks: Showers could have been a little hotter
review.locationRemarks: Close to Chinatown, blues clubs, Little Italy ,AT&T park, shopping and restaurants

review.title: loved it!

review.title: Comfortable Hotel in good location.
review.reviewText: This was my second stay in San Francisco and I was very pleased with the hotel. The location is close to Union Square shops, cable cars and China town. The staff were friendly and helpful in this i would like to include the cleaning staff who prepared the room to a high standard. Our room was on the tenth floor and to the rear of the hotel the view is not fantastic but it made up for it with being quiet. I would have no reservation recommending this to a friend and would use again.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was a great size for a city hotel and the bed was very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: No real problems with the hotel I see other people stated the reception needed an up date but I feel it acceptable as mostly just passed through it.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Very comfortable stay. Large room, with everything we needed. Great location, friendly helpful staff. Would stay there again.

review.positiveRemarks: Close to Union square and the transport
review.negativeRemarks: The noise in the mornings

review.title: Follow up customer issues.
review.reviewText: A couple of issues were not responded to by the front desk. An ATM issue within the hotel and a reply to a charge for incidentals. The latter however was explained on the second occasion.
review.positiveRemarks: The self contained kitchen facilities,the tea and coffee facility on C level along with the help by the staff members .The TV in the bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: The close proximity to the noisy night club.
review.locationRemarks: Very well located.

review.title: Great location, great happy hour. Staff are friend
review.reviewText:
We loved our stay. We'll be sure to go back.
They have a great happy hour that recurrs at 9:30 pm for guests. Free wine social on Friday night. Rooms are spacious and the bed is comfy.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, location, facility, happy hour And social atmosphere.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower faucet is a mystery puzzle, dont shower if you've been drinking
review.locationRemarks: Lots to do, right at union square. Two blocks to theater district.

review.title: Most enjoyable stay in heart of downtown San Fran
review.reviewText: Hotel was extremely clean and very nice. Staff was extremely courteous and very friendly. Hotel location is perfect for people wanting to stay close to downtown (Union Square). Close to everything - shopping, nice eateries, trolley cars, buses etc. Our stay was most enjoyable and the friendly staff made it even more so. Only issue - noisy room at night. Hardly any soundproofing.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean rooms, lots of room. Extremely knowledgeable and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise at night.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location - walking distance to Union Square, lots of good eateries and to trolley, buses etc

review.title: Fantastic stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
This hotel is in an excellent location for both tourists and business travelers alike. I found the room to be spacious and comfortable. The housekeeping staff were diligent and careful ... although vacuuming wasn't always fantastic. The exercise room was just okay ... it is very small and the limited amount of training equipment is crammed into very tight quarters.

I will, however, recommend this hotel to my friends and will definitely stay at this hotel if I should have the opportunity to visit San Francisco again.
review.locationRemarks: The Donatello is in a perfect location for shopping, theatre, and dining.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Chanced the Expedia hidden deals and ended up at this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: great location - easy to get to a variety of public transportation including BART, cable car, buses, and streetcar.
review.negativeRemarks: The wi-fi was quite slow.

review.title: Great place to stay.
review.reviewText: Extremely helpful staff, especially Jesus on the front reception area. Location of hotel is in a great position and rooms are big and well set out.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit noisy on a Friday night from the street noise but the location of Hotel is near all you require.
review.locationRemarks: Great,

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel and we really enjoyed our stay. The location is excellant being nice and close to union square. The room size was outstanding with a king bed and a queen size pull out sofa, which our son happily slept on. Most importanly the price was right at $175 a night. On one night we ate at the hotel's italian restaurant and were happily surprised at the quality of food. I would recommend this hotel to anybody.
review.negativeRemarks: None come to mind
review.locationRemarks: Nice and close to union square

review.title: Cool San Fran, warm Donatello Hotel
review.reviewText:
The Donatello is situated close to shopping, ChinaTown, financial district, near the trams and only 10 mins from Fisherman Wharf on the F1 tram.
The hotel is very clean on the inside; staff are very patient and knowledgeable. We had a great room on the tenth floor, but don't expect a great view of the harbor. Our room was cleaned and serviced each day during our 8 nights in San Fran. There is a great lounge on the 11th floor to mingle and drink coffee or if you are energetic a full gym. We would certainly stay there again. I would have rated this hotel as a 5 but some of the lovely people of SF who drink, yell and play throw the bottle at 2 am, meant we had some difficulty in sleeping, particularly on a Friday or Saturday night.
The weather in SF is quite unpredictable and the evenings are cool (in early April).
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly, very clean, large rooms, great bed
review.negativeRemarks: Excess noise of strangers in the street
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping and central to most tourist destinations. Easy access to public transport

review.title: Great hotel in heart of Union Square San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Great location, good size room. Staff very friendly and courteous. Close to shops and restaurants, safe to walk at night time.
The only downside was a close night club, which closed at approx 2:30am every morning and patrons woke us up everytime.
review.negativeRemarks: the nightclub down the road.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect walking distance to catch the cable cars, restaurants and shops.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly service, large family room. Good location near to bus stops and restaurants.

review.title: Great family hotel!
review.reviewText: Great hotel ! Loved that it had a mini fridge and microwave .Wonderful location close to Union Square, shops, restaurants, Chinatown and of course the cable cars! Staff was very friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend ! Woul also recommend getting the Citypass- which gave access to public transport- including cable cars as well as museums in the city. The De Young museum was truly a gem!

review.title: Nice but outside noise makes it difficult to sleep
review.reviewText: Too much noise outside (construction and homeless people).
review.negativeRemarks: Too much noise outside and homeless people everywhere outside bothering us.
review.locationRemarks: Location is supposed to be nice but homeless people distract from it.

review.title: The place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very welcoming and friendly staff. Extremely quiet. Excellent central location; near restaurants and Union Square. Room was always clean and bed turned down at night. Wonderful jazz bar on second level. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Nice Hotel with great location
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were quite friendly. The location is great. It is an easy walk to Union Square and China Town, but be careful not to go towards the Tenderloin because that area is quite sketchy. It is easy to walk down to Market Street to take F-line streetcar to Fisherman's Wharf. The in-screen TV in the bathroom made getting ready in the morning fun. There are many good restaurants within easy walking distance. The only downsides were the bed was a touch firm for my tastes and the city picks up garbage at about 5 a.m. and I'm a light sleeper so it woke me up. The hotel concierges were all very friendly, but some had better advice than others. I would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Firm beds.
review.locationRemarks: Safe location, close to lots of good tourist attractions.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText:
Good location to city centre. Great club lounge on roof top offering coffee, tea, newspapers free wi fi and friendly concierge
Big room with loung and modern decor
review.negativeRemarks: No buffet breakfast available
review.locationRemarks: Close to Chinatown and city centre

review.title: Beautiful, modern, location
review.reviewText: Beautifully updated, large rooms, tv in the bathroom built into the mirror! Pretty cool! If rates are in budget for me I will absolutely return here!

review.title: Very pleased
review.reviewText: From the very minute upon our arrival, we were taken care of by the wonderful staff. From the valet to the concierge at check in, everyone was very pleasant and helpful. They offered advice for dining and entertainment in and around union square and also sent up commentary wine and chocolate package since we were celebrating our anniversary. Rooms were very spacious by San Francisco standards and well kept. Can't find anything to complain about without being overly picky.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was amazing. Parking rates best in area.
review.negativeRemarks: No big deal, but would be cool to have better view. No fault of hotel.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great. Nothing too far to walk to.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel Great Location
review.reviewText:
Very nice reception staff, always helpful. King size room with plenty of room to unpack.. Bathroom was beautiful, would definitely stay at The Donatellonagain.

5 minute walk to Union Square and the Cable Car
review.positiveRemarks: Lovely friendly staff, close to Union Square
review.locationRemarks: Great location to restaurants, shopping, cabe car and Union Square

review.title: A Gem of a Hotel
review.reviewText: This was a Hotel I picked from reading reviews and I was not disappointed. It is very close to Union Square and the cable car stops and very quiet. I would recommend it to others with no hesitation. Excellent price also.
review.negativeRemarks: The Concierge was not always available during the day or we might have been unlucky
review.locationRemarks: Very central

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: Awesome service! The lobby seemed a little old, but the room was spectacular! It was big enough for the three of us to stay in, and there was a TV built into the mirror of the washroom mirror. Overall, a great stay! Good value at the location too - right in the middle of downtown near Union Square.

review.title: Great staff & excellent location
review.reviewText: Donatello is located close to all the Union Sq action and apart from the noise of a nightclub down the street (New Years Eve) was an excellent location for us. The room was spacious and of a high standard, the staff were very obliging and knew the area well. This is a safe location, plenty of small cafes for breakfast and only a block or two to restaurants of good quality. We would stay here again without hesitation.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, cheerful even at 0530 in the morning
review.negativeRemarks: 3 noisy evenings (of 4) with nightclub located approx 75m away
review.locationRemarks: We walked everywhere from here, the Orpheum, Union Sq and Fishermans Wharfe

review.title: Good value near Union Square
review.reviewText: Good value in central San Francisco. Room overlooking Post Street a bit noisy. Room furnishings were a bit spartan but the room was nice and big,

review.title: Donatello stay Feb 2013
review.reviewText: Great location and a very comfortable, clean and welcoming hotel. Would be very happy to recommend to family and friends

review.title: A True Bargin
review.reviewText: I stay in SF for about a week every month, usually staying in a different hotel each time. This is by far one of the nicer places.

review.title: An excellent choice for downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at the Donatello. The staff at the front desk were amazing. They were very welcoming and genuine in offering assistance with respect to what to do & where to go. Unfortunately, housekeeping let us down on the first day. With check-in at 3pm, we did not get into the room until 4.30pm and given we were exhausted from our travels this was frustrating. Full credit to the front desk who rectified the situation by providing us with complimentary sparkling wine & chocolates - a gesture we sincerely appreciated. The room itself had all the essentials and was very spacious and lovely to come back to after a day of sightseeing/shopping. The tv in the bathroom was fantastic! We dined at the restaurant's hotel on one night and found both the service & the food to be of a very good standard. The down town location was perfect for our shopping needs and gave us ease of access to both the cable cables & F train for heading the the tourist areas of Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz etc.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal for the downtown experience

review.title: San Francisco stay
review.reviewText: frendly helpfull staff.Compfortable bed and sofa bed.Staff happy to recommend eateries not just their own
review.locationRemarks: 1 block from union square(2min walk)

review.title: Family Xmas 2012
review.reviewText:
Very good room. Modern, large. Great for our son to have his own sofa bed.
Good friendly service.
Great location.
Only downside was that the windows were thin causing noise. Donatello please retro fit double glazing on the inside of the existing windows so I can score you 100% next time.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise - thin windows
review.locationRemarks: Perfect.

review.title: Great value for money hotel
review.reviewText: Had a great stay at the Donatello. The king bed and sofa bed were very comfortable. The staff very friendly and helpful. Location is very central, a block away from Union Square, close to Chinatown and Nob Hill. A lovely lounge upstairs where you could have complementary tea, coffee or hot chocolate.

review.title: In the midst of the action
review.reviewText: Good centrally located hotel - right in the midst of the action. Staff were very friendly and helpful. In-house restaurant is small but food is ok, if a touch on the expensive side. Would definitely stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: I felt the staff could have cleaned the rooms better. This let the hotel down slightly.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the trolley line. Handy to shops and entertainment.

review.title: Australin Review.
review.reviewText:
Very Good Motel. Staff a pleasure to ask and get required information. Well done.

Thanks.
review.negativeRemarks: Nil
review.locationRemarks: Great and close to CBD.

review.title: Quality Hotel
review.reviewText:
Good sized room for family of 4. Quality service and clean rooms with space.
Very good location to Union Square and cable car.
Highly recommend to all visiting San Francisco
review.positiveRemarks: Location, room size and hotel service
review.locationRemarks: easy walk to Union Square and cable car.

review.title: We would love to come back!
review.reviewText:
We are a family of 4 (children aged 20 & 16) visiting from Australia. We found the Donatello to be welcoming, clean, competitively priced and very well located. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there and would definitely return if lucky enough to be able to visit San Francisco again. We have no hesitation in recommending the Donatello to family and friends.
Cheers
Fry family
Brisbane, Australia
review.negativeRemarks: Wish we could stay longer
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to Union Square, transport & lots of places eat & shop

review.title: Very enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: We found the hotel very well run and very well located. Easy access to much of what the city has to offer. We did not "take advantage" of any of the wine/cheese events or any of the "opportunities" to learn about the vacation club. The staff was very helpful and immediately responded to one small problem - the hairdryer didn't work and they replaced it shortly after I made them aware of the problem.
review.locationRemarks: very short walk to Union Square

review.title: Great location, exceptional staff
review.reviewText: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Donatello. Stayed here for 5 nights in December with 2 kids. Very spacious room, great location and staff were all friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend the Donatello for families and couples. The complimentary tea, coffee and hot chocolate in the club room was an added treat.

review.title: Comfortable stay
review.reviewText:
Hotel is conveniently located one block from union square, Macy, the Powell-mason cable car line. There are many restaurants & malls nearby. The surrounding is safe
The room is clean.
Just one minor incident on the second night of our stay when the fire alarm went off and we had to walk down 9 floors & waited by the road in the cold for about 30-40 minutes before it was declared safe for us to return.
We were a slightly traumatized by the incident!
Other than that, the room was big, bathroom clean n neat.
Overall, a comfortable stay for a family of 4
review.negativeRemarks: Fire alarm
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located

review.title: Big Room! Great comfy bed. Great Location
review.reviewText: They don't openly advertise the desiginted smoking area which is upstairs in the club area. So my mum had to stand outside in the street in the cold for the first few days until we discovered it. Room service pizzas were cardboard and cold. Bed was huge and comfy. Room was huge for 3 people. Great tv channels. Location is fantastic.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed, Room size, Tv Channels, lovely service staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Not being told that there was somewhere my mum could smoke, apart from the street.
review.locationRemarks: Great Location, right in the middle of Union Square Shops!!! Brilliant Location

review.title: Awesome Location and great service
review.reviewText: The hotel was located only a block from Union Square where it was so easy to catch a cable car or shop and eat. The hotel was so clean and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We found San Fran had a high density of homelessness but the Hotel was situated so that we we're slightly hidden from this, and the hussle and bussle, yet could easily walk 2-5 minutes and be in the thick of it if we wanted to. The two musts we were looking for at this hotel were location and cleanliness and I can safely say that these were well and truly ticked off.

review.title: The Donatello was sensational
review.reviewText: We can't say enough good things about this hotel. It was so much better than we expected. All of the staff were so friendly and helpful. The room was enormous with a separate wardrobe/dressing area outside the bathroom so the room wasn't strewn with our luggage. It was great to have a wet bar and the king size bed was soooooo comfortable. The location was fantastic as well. So close to everything. We absolutely loved this hotel and would definitely go back if we ever get to return to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The very friendly and helpful staff and the large rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: One block from Union Square and close to many great restaurants and bars. Transport was on the doorstep as well.

review.title: Donatello hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel & would recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: The room had no view as the room was out the rear side of the buidling. But we looked beyond that and enjoyed San Francisco and what it had to offer
review.locationRemarks: Great. Close to union square which is a must.

review.title: review
review.reviewText: excellent is all respects - recommended for everyone

review.title: Pleasant, Well Placed, Not Cookie Cutter Style
review.reviewText: We were not aware that this hotel sells vacation shares. As soon as we checked in and while still at the registration desk, we were directed to the adjoining desk where we received a fairly hard sell pitch on buying into these shares. When we indicated we were not interested and just wanted to enjoy our two nights at the hotel to visit nearby Union Square and other attractions in San Francisco, the salesman pushed our attending the two hour sales meeting as a way or canceling our parking fees. This was the only detraction from an otherwise pleasant stay. Bellmen and other hotel staff were helpful. We enjoyed the second floor Mediterranean-themed restaurant as well; it has the convenience of an on-site location in cold or bad weather and offered some creative dishes and attentive service but was not exceptional in food preparation or value for the money.
review.negativeRemarks: Sales pitch at check-in
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to Union Square, China Town, Shopping

review.title: A great room and friendly, top-notch service
review.reviewText: The Donatello offers just the right combination of quality accommodations and friendly, down-to-earth service. The warm greeting we received at the reception desk set the tone for the rest of our stay; every employee we came in contact with offered help or advice with a smile. Our king room was very generous in size, including a sofa and mini kitchen, complete with sink, microwave, fridge and a drawer with silverware, wine opener and dishtowels. It was perfect for a lazy breakfast or late night picnic in the room. The hotel location is just right--a block off Union Square and around the corner from the theater district. All this at a reasonable price--we will be back.

review.title: Great hotel for both short and long stay
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a great location. The staff were excellent, and the overall accommodation was of a good standard. The staff were genuinely chatty and friendly, and responded quickly to one or two minor issues we had.
review.positiveRemarks: The TV built into the bathroom mirror was a nice touch. We thought it was a simple yet a very clever idea.
review.negativeRemarks: Some of the hotel room equipment on the upper levels look dated. Though they are being replaced all the time with new items.
review.locationRemarks: One block from Union Square. Very easy to reach by using the BART (Bay Area Rapid Transport) which runs directly to San Francisco main airport.

review.title: Awesome!
review.reviewText: My husband and i went here for 2 nights.. We were more than happy on what we got,, the room was so clean, modern interiors , jacuzzi was awesome!!! And we get to watch tv while using the bathroom.. I was expecting it will be noisy on the streets at night but we didnt heard any and we had a very comfortable good night sleep.. We will definitley go back here . Oh forgot to mention they have a mini kitchenette , it has everything!!! All the utensils u might need even wine glasses! Not a waste of money!!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location

review.title: Would I stay here again? You bet ya.
review.reviewText:
Arriving on Thanksgiving evening and wanting somewhere to eat was a challenge that the hotel met easily and quickly for us. Before we knew it a reservation had been made at their restaurant and we were accommodated without fuss to a really great meal.
The room we had was beyond our expectations and was BIG which meant we had lots of room - even a comfortable couch to sit on!
The staff were friendly - greeting us as we got out of the elevators in the morning and checking to see if there was anything we needed. A really personal touch which we appreciated. The complimentary club lounge on the top floor of the hotel was an added bonus.
And where the hotel is situated is really fantastic. We were within walking distance of union square, the big shops like Macy's and had a good selection of restaurants and cafes nearby.
review.positiveRemarks: the location, the condition of the room and the friendliness of the staff
review.locationRemarks: easy to find and easy to access shops and restaurants

review.title: Bravo Donatello
review.reviewText:
-Welcomed us with friendly greeting and a free bottle of champagne, wine or glass and chocolates
-easy access to Union Square and trolley which was a block away
-comfortable bed
-spacious room
-free WIFI
-new modern furnishings
-TV in the bathroom!
-clean
review.positiveRemarks: The TV in the bathroom! That's a bonus but most importantly how comfortable the bed was and how the room felt overall.
review.negativeRemarks: Only thing was I was charged for long distance for calling a little out of bay area.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. A block away from Union Square-close to stores for shopping so a little hidden from the main street.

review.title: Donatello was a hit!
review.reviewText:
The hotel is newly and beautifully decorated. Great location. We asked for a room away
from street noise and high up and we got it. Very quiet up there- we got a great night's
sleep. The restaurant that supplies the room service is excellent. The only quibble I have is that you can't get breakfast in-house. No roomservice or restaurant open at that hour. But there's plenty of food nearby. The price is nothing for this quality hotel. Recommend it highly.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor, the quiet, the food, and the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: No breakfast. Not a big deal.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square. OK neighborhood. Might be noisy if you're on the street side.

review.title: a review
review.reviewText: They market a big room and that is certainly what you will get. Overall, this is the place for a good value room near union square. The staff always greeted us enthusiastically and were very helpful. The gym is not the best, but the restaurant (eat during happy hour for half-price at the bar) is cozy. The view from the 14th floor is nice and a great place to read a book or sit with friends/family. Considering where you are in SF, it is a great deal.

review.title: Outstanding Service with great location
review.reviewText: Booked this hotel purely off the ratings from others on TripAdvisor and the reviews were accurate. Great location just a block from Union Square, rooms comfy and clean but what set it apart was the service... From moment arrived made to feel very welcome and advice on places to see / eat etc from the staff. The Club level is great, bar to relax in, would definitely stay here again
review.locationRemarks: Excellent base from Union Square and Biscuits and blues next door is a great club

review.title: Perfect hotel in a perfect location
review.reviewText: Staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms were a good size and had everything we needed and the location was perfect. Very happy with our stay.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText:
I stayed in room 1005, on the tenth floor. I had called ahead to request a "quiet" room. If 1005 is considered quiet, then I'd hate to stay in another area of the hotel. There was quite a lot of street noise in 1005. The room had a dressing area (closet, dresser, bench, mirror), a bathroom, then the general living/sleeping area. There was a sleeper sofa, which I didn't use as a bed, and the sofa was very comfortable. There is a kitchen area with small fridge, microwave, sink, dishes and silverware. The bed was very comfortable, sturdy mattress, and the linens were nice. The room was very nice and quite large for a "big city" hotel.

The hotel also has a Club level at the top of the hotel that offers coffee, tea, a smoking area outside, etc. Very nice.

The location of the hotel is right downtown, a block off of Powell. It's up 4 blocks from Market St, and it's the last "flat" street. One more block north starts an uphill trek. I took the BART train from the SF Airport with one suitcase, got off at the Powell station and it was very walkable to the hotel.

I travel alone, a single woman. So safety is always a key factor for me. I never felt like I was in danger. However there are homeless people everywhere in the downtown area, including right outside the hotel occasionally.

This hotel is also a timeshare. I listened to the sales pitch introduction upon checkin, declined the conference invite, and was then left alone the remainder of my stay - no harassment.
review.positiveRemarks: Size and comfort of room, Club level coffee and outside lounge area.
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise and bums outside the hotel.

review.title: Top for SanFran
review.reviewText: First class hotel visit, great location. Staff were excellent and very accommodating when we had to extend our trip (due to Sandy). Junior suite fine for family of (young) 4. Concierge knew the ins/outs and most helpful in securing bookings/recommendations.
review.locationRemarks: One block from Union Square

review.title: Great hotel for a few days in the city.
review.reviewText: I don't like that almost all hotels have very warm down comforters. These are really too much in San Francisco. I either have to open a window or turn the fan on... that does not make sense from a comfort or environmental perspective.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel all round
review.reviewText: This was the nicest surprise of our trip around the USA. Our room was spacious and like the rest of the hotel just recently been renovated. It smelled like a new house when we walked in the door. Was so lovely to come back to after a busy day The fridge, microwave and coffee machine top notch. Also included were wine glasses and champagne glasses, plates bowls and cutlery if we chose to be independant. The service was fantastic, the position really convenient, one block from Union Square for the shops and the cable cars. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends.
review.positiveRemarks: It had recently been very tastefully renovated and the rooms were really spacious
review.negativeRemarks: can't think of one
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for what we needed on a holiday

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Everything I need was furnished. I like Donatello's most so far.
review.positiveRemarks: The atmosphere and service staff provided me.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing this time.

review.title: Big thumbs up!!!!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, fantastic location, more than meeted expectations, close to shops, trolley, restaurants, would definately stay again!!
review.positiveRemarks: Spacy rooms, spa was great after long days of exploring, hot chocolate was awesome!!!

review.title: GREAT HOTEL TO SEE SAN Fran
review.reviewText: Great location -Near AllTransportation-- Hotel Needs Sound Protection to get rid of street noise at night

review.title: Hotel review
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and close to main street where cable car is. No complaints.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was comfortable and the king bed and the queen sofa bed. Kitchenette was great as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect.

review.title: Australian family of 4
review.reviewText: Fantastic location, close to union square, great for families, we were allocated a large king suite which had ample room for older children. Bedding was very comfortable, kitchenette was handy with a traveling family. Valet parking great value compared to other venues, valet service was excellent with taking our luggage to and from our vehicle. Well organised check-in and check-out. Thank-you for a great stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Bedding, size of room and decor.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom a little on the small side for a family of 4 with older children.
review.locationRemarks: Great location next to Union Square, food and entertainment

review.title: Great Location and parking
review.reviewText: The hotel was all we could have asked for, esp. the location. The staff was very professional, helpful and friendly. One thing I would comment on is that the hallways are dark and grey...I would paint the doors the same shade of red that is in the carpet.
review.positiveRemarks: Besides location, the very reasonable parking fee was really a plus
review.negativeRemarks: No fan in the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Perfect, we could walk to everything we wanted.

review.title: Comfortable hotel
review.reviewText:
comfortable hotel close to Union Square.However ,although we had a room on the 10th floor outside noise was a problem due to large single glazed windows.
We would stay here again and recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable and spacious. The staff were helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise at night
review.locationRemarks: Good city centre location

review.title: Excellent Hotel And Location
review.reviewText:
Excellent clean hotel, excellent location, one block to Union Sqaure!

Just beware, they do hold funds on your credit card for incidentals and it can take up to a week for the funds to be released! This wasn't explained at Checkin!
review.negativeRemarks: Holding funds on credit card for incidentals when not advised!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location one block from Union Square and the shops!

review.title: Would definitely stay again!
review.reviewText: Really large comfortable rooms, excellent facilities. Really good location and friendly staff.

review.title: The Donatello hotel - newly renovated rooms!
review.reviewText:
The Donatello hotel was great. Check-in was quick, however the staff at the front counter were not very welcoming. When we stumbled into the hotel, we were not greeted by the counter staff. They only spoke when spoken to.

The hotel room was newly renovated, which was very nice. They provided a small kitchen area, with a sink and the necessary utensils for a small meal. The microwave oven was very handy too. The only thing that I would suggest is that they change the complimentary shampoo and conditioner that they provide. The shampoo smelt like honey and did not lather well. It did not even feel as if it was cleaning our hair. The conditioner did not make our hair feel nice after use at all.

The location of the hotel is ok. It is located just a block away from union square, which is where all the shopping is. Closer still, are hotels around the Market St area which we probably would have preferred.
review.negativeRemarks: Quality of toiletries provided

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: The Donatello was very comfortable and the location is great. I would stay here again. The room was rather large for a city. I liked having the mini fridge and microwave. The bed was very comfortable, great after a long day sight-sighting.
review.positiveRemarks: The cafe and concierge on the top floor
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Union Square location is very convenient

review.title: Donatello Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel in an excellent location. The staff are very helpful and cheerful. We never tried the restaurant but there quite a few within easy walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: excellent location and easy walking distance to Union Square

review.title: Huge and comfortable room.
review.reviewText: We had a huge room with a giant comfortable bed and comfortable lounge. There was even a TV screen built into the mirror in the bathroom so you could watch TV while in the bath! We were on the 10th floor and the huge windows provided a fantastic view. We would stay there again for sure. Visited the club lounge on the top floor each night to get a free tea or coffee.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed, giant windows, TV screen in bathroom mirror so you could watch TV from the bath.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't really think of anything bad...Maybe they could have provided free cookies in the club lounge to have with the tea and coffee.
review.locationRemarks: Brilliant, one block away from Union Square.

review.title: Independent travel for Seniors
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the accommodation, mini kitchen,open fridge,good space etc. A very good patrons club area on the top floor, excellent free early morning coffee won many brownie points to start the day. Walk four blocks on an easy slope produced next to nothing travel all over SAn Fran. We are in our seventies and it easy and enjoyable

review.title: Central and good value.
review.reviewText: Very central to most things. Great value compare to some of the placesI`ve stayed at.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and king size bed. The TV in the bathroom helps if you are sharing the room like I did with my parents.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near Union sq, Macy and China Town.

review.title: Good stay but noise from hotel frank a shame
review.reviewText: The only complaint I have is the noise from the night club opposite and the protesters who make a huge amount of noise from 7 am in the morning this spoilt it a little for us especially when you have travelled 11 hours and have a 9 hour time difference

review.title: great bargain and friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Not sure when hotel was made but i do wish there were vents in the bathroom because the mirrors would steam up. I was in the 10th floor and when i would take a shower the water temperature would fluctuate and would not stay at desired temp. Over all i was pleased with my stay and hotel was close to all i needed. Shopping, food, entertainment. I will consider this hotel in the future.
review.negativeRemarks: Torn blankets. We had to have a maid redo our bed at arrival
review.locationRemarks: Nice side of town but to many bums and beggars. Not hotels fault.

review.title: super
review.reviewText: Our stay in San Francisco was great, the hotel staff were very helpful, nothing was too difficult, the rooms were terrific, compfy and clean, the only complaint was the parking fee was too expensive, $36 per day was a bit steep, for people staying at the hotel, I think a $10 -15 per day is fair. Travelling thru 17 states, over 6 weeks the Donetello was very nice and would stay there again, The protestors outside our window at 7am did'nt help but that was not the hotel 's fault.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Great, centeral to everything

review.title: large, clean, and comfortable rooms
review.reviewText: Spent four nights at the Donatello and enjoyed it very much. The rooms were large, clean, and comfortable. The location is great. The staff was friendly. I would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: a little pricey for a family vacation
review.locationRemarks: very conveniently located near Union Square

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Great location (close to Union Square). Friendly staff. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText:
Such a beautiful hotel loved it!
Friendly staff, great location, beautiful and Clean rooms.
We would love to stay here again if we ever come back to the states.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed was soo comfortable and our room was upgraded because we were on our honeymoon.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The location is ideal, the staff very friendly and accommodating. Their restaurant food was really good a bit expensive for families. The only problem about this hotel is the noise, if you are on the street side you hear everything. Figuring out a way to block out the loud street noise would be a great update; Other than that I really enjoyed my stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, club room and the bed.
review.negativeRemarks: street noise
review.locationRemarks: Good location to shopping ,entertainment and dining

review.title: Went the extra mile!
review.reviewText: The Donatello staff went the extra mile to think ahead of to what needs we might have. Housekeeping checked in just to make sure we had everything we needed and the front desk helped out with lots of transportation needs.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 5 nights and could not have been happier. The staff were extremely helpful - nothing was too much trouble for them. The position of the hotel was perfect - close enough to Union Square so that you can walk there in two minutes with plenty of options as to where to go from there. The room was large and easily accommodated two adults and a teenager with space to move. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and I would certainly stay there on my next trip.

review.title: Great Hotel in good location
review.reviewText:
Location - perfect, 1 block from union square

Staff - excellent, very friendly and professional. More than happy to give advice/information

Rooms - clean and comfortable. The only negative is if you get a room on the post st side then it can be quite noisy through the night.

Parking - valet parking at the hotel charged at a cost of course.

Overall experience was very positive and highly recommend

Good value for money
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: 1 block from union square

review.title: Enjoyable!
review.reviewText:
The hotel was very comfortable, nice decor and roomy. We were in a corner room and it was a bit noisy all through the night.
Great choice of hotel to celebrate our 30th Anniversary. The 15th floor terrace was great!
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for shopping and dining and a short bus or cab ride to the coast

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Disapointed about no complimentary breakfast, had it 3 years ago, kitchenette was a great setup. Not pestered into some type of time share,overall a great hotel & stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff and turn down service@ night
review.negativeRemarks: No complimentary breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Great location especially after walking union square

review.title: Classy yet friendly--a winner!
review.reviewText:
Staff is very friendly, not a bit snooty, especially for such a lovely hotel. The room was beautifully decorated, very modern, and fully furnished with a microwave, fridge, dishes, etc., without my having expected those amenities. The neighborhood is upscale and great for shopping. The Italian restaurant in the hotel served an exquisite dinner. I did not visit the exercise room and sauna.

The only downside is the absence of a true business center. The amenities include only a tiny room with a computer and printer.

I will return to this very classy, friendly hotel. It could be the nicest one I have stayed in this year, and I travel a lot.
review.negativeRemarks: No real business center.
review.locationRemarks: Upscale, central, good shopping.

review.title: A good value Hotel
review.reviewText: We found the staff very helpful and the hotel good value. There is an ongoing and quite loud demonstration outside a nearby hotel, which you could hear from the room we were initially assigned. The staff arranged to move us to a room overlooking Post Street where you could not hear the demonstration. There are good restaurants nearby; we liked Ryoko's Japanese restaurant and the italian Fino Restorante at the Andews Hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit noisy in some rooms
review.locationRemarks: Quite central

review.title: Gem in San Fran!
review.reviewText: Amazing stay, I would recommend this to anyone wanting to stay in a non-chain hotel. Rooms have recently been redone, super nice. View from the club level amazing! Can’t wait to come back, and will be staying at the Donatello!
review.negativeRemarks: To close to the hotel Frank
review.locationRemarks: Great central location to seeing all the tourist spots

review.title: efficient friendly staff.
review.reviewText: A very enjoyable experience. Great location. Very helpful staff. Room very clean and any small problems were dealt with efficiently and quickly. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
Get room at higher level as if face street can be very noisy during the night
Great location, friendly staff and fantastic size rooms especially for families

review.title: Top quality - definitely recommend
review.reviewText:
This hotel is better than the pictures show on Expedia. The room is large, the king bed is of high quality, and all the pillows are great to sleep on. There is a fridge and microwave in the room, and a little sink. The TV is new and has a great picture. There is also a TV inside the mirror in the Bathroom (not that we used it). The location is great, just a couple blooks from all the main shopping. There are restaurants everywhere, and there is a Avis rent a car on the street.

Everything in the room appears to be new and spotlessly clean

I highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

If you plan on visiting Alcatraz, word of advice: Book your ferry ticket in advance!
review.negativeRemarks: No complaints - 100% pleasant experience
review.locationRemarks: Tip Top!

review.title: Night people (vampires)
review.reviewText: Excellent quality hotel. Asked for a great view of the city on a high floor. Staffer warned me about the street noise. A lot of night people out there and it was noisy. However , I was warned. All in all we had a great time.
review.negativeRemarks: No free breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Almost central to everything

review.title: EXCELLENT LOCATION
review.reviewText: Excellent location!! Steps from Union Square. The staff is great!! The rooms are very spacious. The only problem is that outside noise in the weekends nights is heard in the rooms because the walls are very thin. But I recommend it...specially if you have kids.
review.negativeRemarks: No breakfast!! But in the next corner you can go to Honey Honey. A great place to breakfast and lunch.
review.locationRemarks: Great!!!

review.title: Good and Comfortable
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a very handy location to the Union Square, shops and transportation. We stayed for three nights and everything is clean and comfortable. There are six of us and we can meet at the Club Lounge for coffee and is very handy for us to wait there for our later afternoon flight after checking out of our rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: noon
review.locationRemarks: near Union Square

review.title: Great hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText:
This hotel is in a brilliant location just a block from Union Square and very close to transportation of all sorts. It was clean and comfortable-our room was huge with a fridge, microwave and a tv in the bathroom! The staff were unfailingly polite, friendly and extremely helpful. Club Donatello on the top floor provided free hot drinks in a comfortable lounge with a balcony next to the small gym, sauna and jacuzzi.
The Italian restaurant was very good though not cheap and there were several small diners within a block of the hotel where we found excellent breakfasts (and other meals!) - we particularly used Honey Honey.
The only drawback was some minimal noise from the nightclub nearby and occasional chanting from a picket line at another hotel but this was a small price to pay for an excellent hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient

review.title: Good Location/Comfortable Stay
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Donatello for 8 nights and thought the hotel was very good. The location was great, very central and close to Union Square. There was free wii fii and also free coffee/tea in the club lounge. The hotel room itself was very spacious and had a modern feel. The facilities in the room were good and had a small kitchen area with coffee machine/microwave/fridge/ and sink. There was also a comfortable sofa with foot stalls and a huge bed.
The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful.On the whole our experience was positive, but the two negatives we noted were that the reception area and also the Club Lounge could do with being updated to match the quality of the rooms. We also thought that it would be good idea to double glaze the windows as we heard the dustmen came along between 1and 3am,and we also heard the protesters on a loud speaker chanting at around 6 am Sunday morning. (none of these we the hotels fault)
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise
review.locationRemarks: Very central/close to Union Square

review.title: Quality hotel, in a great location
review.reviewText:
Great location , just one block from union square, with nice rooms,attentive staff and well informed concierge.
The Italian restaurant on site was very good, with quality food and a well priced wine list.
WiFi was free, as it should be in 2012.
We really enjoyed the hotel , location was excellent and the rooms very comfortable .
review.positiveRemarks: The room comfort, location and free wifi
review.negativeRemarks: No complaints
review.locationRemarks: One block from union square - It doesn't get any better

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: The location was great and every service were pretty good.

review.title: Friendly staff make for a great stay!
review.reviewText: This hotel was awesome! The staff was super friendly and helpful. Rooms are being updated to a more modern/sleek style. Despite the construction on some of the floors we did not expereience any dust/debris or loud noises. The club level has free coffee, tea, and hot chocolate pretty much all day and also provides a nice place to sit and plan your day. The proxcimity to Union Square, as well as cable lines and Powell Street BART station made getting around the city a breeze! When I'm back in SF I will definitely stay here again!

review.title: Long Week-End in San Fran
review.reviewText: Great location. Could not fault this hotel. Loved the TV in the mirror in the bathroom, not necessary but a little luxury.
review.negativeRemarks: There was a picket line at a nearby hotel, therefore a little noisy.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to cable cars, hop-on hop-off buses & Union Square

review.title: Loved the Donatello/San Fran
review.reviewText: WOW - loved the Donatello. We were so pleased with our choice of accommodation for location, comfort and cleanliness. We had a renovated room on the 7th floor and the decor is lovely. Mini kitchen is a bonus when travelling and we had a lovely stay for 3 nights.
review.locationRemarks: so close to Union Square

review.title: Great Location Great!!!!
review.reviewText: Great Location, well priced hotel staff are great! Would definitely return to The Donatello when next in San Francisco.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: Everything and eveyone on the staff was just great. From the comfortable bed and black out drapes to the food from room service everything worked to make our stay a pleasure.
review.locationRemarks: Easy 1 block walk to Union Square and Powell St. cable car.

review.title: Good choice
review.reviewText: Very good location, very clean comfortable rooms. Fabulous comfortable bed. However, rooms situated on the side facing Mason street, could be a little noisy due to the proximity of the local nightclub.

review.title: Exceptional staff!
review.reviewText: The staff was very attentive. I left my battery charger and battery to my camera plugged in at the room when we checked out. Went back to the hotel later to try and retrieve it. The maid had already cleaned our room and put the item in a bag labeled with the date and our room number. I was so appreciative of the staff's honesty and integrity!
review.positiveRemarks: The friendly staff, the complimentary wine and cheese, and the comfortable rooms (comfy bed, refrigerator, microwave, tv in the bathroom).
review.negativeRemarks: The street got noisy at 2:00 a.m. when the bars let out. But that's to be expected when you're sleeping in the heart of the city.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. An easy walk to Union Square.

review.title: Relaxing stay.
review.reviewText:
The Club at the top floor is nice but appeared not so well patronized. Morning coffee/tea could improve if there are some cookies and fruits, similar to other hotels around the area.

The room is big and comfortable.

The locality is great, close to some excellent restaurants and of course the shopping area.
review.locationRemarks: Great.

review.title: Perfect place in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: We felt welcome from the moment we stepped in.The cleanliness of the room was surprising, the room was newly renovated and all the facilities were up to date. Location of the hotel is great, walking distance to Union Square, shops, restaurants, buses, cable car.The whole experience in San Francisco was very pleasant and complimented with The Donatello Hotel. I would warmly recommend this hotel to everyone and would definitely stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: The best

review.title: Room Review
review.reviewText: The room was modern, but the bathroom shower needed updates and it had mold in the ceiling. The hotel is in a great location and the staff is great, but it is very noisy. Did not sleep at all!!

review.title: Wedding Weekend
review.reviewText: Convenient location for my first stay in SF. They are still in the process of updating several floors, so during the day only one elevator was open for guest, the other for construction. We stayed on the 7th floor...still noisy from the streets especially Fri & Sat nights and you can here the demonstration from around the corner at the Frank Hotel starting @ 730am!! They also had to turn the water off on the Friday we were there from 10am to 4pm..that was a bummer since we were there for a wedding and rehearsal was that afternoon...thanks to friends staying across the street @ the Marriott we were able to use their shower!! Check out was kinda crazy...they gave me a bill for $2500.00 even though I booked through Expedia and it was payed for...they could not figure out how I got that bill !!!! I did not have to pay it Thank GOD!! But sad they could not figure it out!! Otherwise my stay was great and I would stay there again, just on a higher floor. It's a very clean & safe hotel!!
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise
review.locationRemarks: very convenient

review.title: Nice place to stay on a trip to the SF Bay Area
review.reviewText:
Hotel was a great place to stay if you are visiting and want to experience the city. The windows in the room could open and were a bit drafty. We were on the eighth floor and could here the city below at all hours. However, whenever I travel this is something I personally enjoy. I don't like the heavily sealed hotel windows that make rooms stuffy and closed off. The location was perfect with easy access to chinatown, north beach, the pier, the port of san francisco, the mission and with a little leg work castro and the haight. Of course it also sits a block off of the union district which has easy cable car access and about 4 blocks away from market street which has the F-line, both easy ways for tourists to commute to different parts of the city. They have a club level and a restaurant but I did not visit those. Also their town car service to SFO is both quick and convenient and at only $45 dollars for the two of us was 15 dollars cheaper than the cab ride we took into the city.

So basically if you want a good city feel on your vacation while also having spacious and very comfortable rooms this is a great place to stay. In room ammenities are up to par including wireless internet. Great location to experience a world class city!
review.positiveRemarks: Big spacious rooms with huge comfortable beds. Good city street views and charming windows to open and enjoy the sounds of the city.
review.locationRemarks: The location is key. Literally most of the cities tourist districts are very easily accessed from here. Shops and restaurants all over in this area.

review.title: Great experience in the City by the Bay...
review.reviewText:
It was only after reading reviews on many different sites that I did cancel our reservations at the St. Francis & took advantage of an Expedia special on the Donatello. This trip was a family trip including my adult children and their two toddler 3 and 2.5 years of age. The plan was to have the older one stay in our room and the younger with Mom and Dad. The St. Francis has an excellent location, however, they charged for the additional roll-away bed and for internet, also it did not have the convenence of the wet-bar 1/4 kitchette. We also wanted a large room and from reviews, it sounded as if the Donatello would fit the bill...and it did, exceeding our expectations! The room was spacious, clean and very well appointed.
They acknowledge my request to have rooms next to each other. The conciege was very helpful, the happy hour at the bar allowed us to bring toddlers for a nosh when it was just too stormy to venture outside one afternoon. Location was perfect for us...our other daughter and grandchildren live off of 5th-SOMA
review.positiveRemarks: LOCATION! COMFORTABLE AND CLEAN...BIG ROOMS PERFECT FOR FAMILY TRAVEL...PRICE ON EXPEDIA!!!
review.negativeRemarks: NOTHING
review.locationRemarks: PERFECT!! minutes to Union Square...Market and Powell to catch cable, Bart or any Muni transportation...

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, room was recently renovated and pretty spacious. Additionally, hotel is located within a block away from Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Can get a bit noisy at times when the club across the street is open.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay here. The rooms were great, very comfortable. The location was awesome as well. My ONLY complaint was that they were in the middle of renovations on other floors and I lost cold water in the shower the day of my checkout, so it wasn't a huge deal and I'm sure they fixed it quickly.

review.title: Great hotel, fab location
review.reviewText: The staff were superb and very helpful during the renovation work. They assisted us with all of our travel and sightseeing requirements with courtesy. The beds were the best I have slept in in a long time. Each room had its own little kitchen area which was great. The hotel was in the best location for Union Square, cafes, art galleries and the shopping centres.
review.negativeRemarks: No breakfast facilities
review.locationRemarks: Superb

review.title: Would recommend this hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel - clean room with comfy bed. All of the concierge's there were great especially Chris and Marianne who were extremely helpful - they went above and beyond to help us locate a notary public on a Sunday evening. The front desk employees and bellmen were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel and would recommend to others.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location - large room with comfy king size bed, free Wi-Fi, small refrig, microwave, sink (outside the bathroom), plates, glasses, silverware
review.negativeRemarks: The hair dryer, which was attached to the bathroom wall, was awful and the cord was way too short.
review.locationRemarks: In the downtown business area - close to restaurants, great shopping and Starbucks.

review.title: Good choice
review.reviewText: Enjoyed stay, everything worked out well!

review.title: Very good hotel even price a bit high
review.reviewText: Excelent location
review.locationRemarks: China town, fisherman wraff

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Great location and friendly staff. We had a family of four and the room catered nicely for us - very comfortable bed.

review.title: Best hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The Donatello was a great base for our San Francisco stay. Close to Union Square, easy walk to MUNI station for public transport, Cable Car stop one block away. The hotel was clean, comfy and well appointed with a kitchenette in our room complete with microwave and fridge. Great beds, comfy and King sized. Rental car depots just a couple of blocks up the street too for anyone driving into the city. Staff were great, helpful, friendly and very knowledgeable. Public transport good, lots to choose from.

review.title: Good hotel - great location - very good service
review.reviewText: The Donatello is conveniently locted close to Union Square. The rooms are spacious - the staff helpful - and the price reasonable. Definitely worth of your considerationon your next visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Good hotel, Good location
review.reviewText: Located in down town the hotel is a 5min walk to china town and loads of different restaurants and shops. A 30min walk or 10min taxi ride will get you down to Fishermans Warf. The rooms were of the quality you would expect for a hotel in this price range. The staff were friendly and helpful. I would stay there again or recommend anyone else to stay there.

review.title: excellent smaller hotel
review.reviewText: The staff in all positions were extremely friendly and helpful. our initial room was noisy so we were moved the next day (at our request) without any hassle.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Close to bus transportation and many restaurants

review.title: Best I've ever seen for the star rating
review.reviewText: Greatly exceeded expectations.

review.title: Great hotel, but not too family friendly
review.reviewText: Hotel does a fabulous job for the price. The rooms are modern and attractive. Having a kitchenette was convenient. The front desk, and the rest of the hotel staff are helpful, and accomodating without being pretenious. The rooms are bright, colorful and modern. There seems to be an issue with the hot water being too hot. I was traveling with a 7 year old who was disappointed there was no pool, but the location was fairly convenient for cable cars and Chinatown. This is probably a better hotel for older travelers (for example--the Club floor has a suana and a dress code)

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: Wonderful location, right downtown but one block away from cable cars and crowd noise. Great restaurants in the area. Hotel was spacious, reasonably priced, and very comfortable. Would happily stay here again.

review.title: Mostly good BUT
review.reviewText:
Hotel was clean, rooms were large, location a block from Union Square was ultra-convenient and appreciated the room facilities (fridge and microwave) and terrace. On the downside
-- interenet in room was constantly on/off. After a minute, hotel wireless network would disappear and it would be necessary to re-log onto ntework only for network to disappear a minute later. The front desk kept saying that they would fix this but hey never did. Only on the last day of my stay did they offer to change my room.
- Street noise was loud during day but OK on last night
- On last night I requested a wake-up call. No call was made the next morning.

review.title: Gem of a hotel by Union Square
review.reviewText:
A small hotel with excellent personal service and value from entering the door through to room service, concierge, bar, and final shuttle to the airport. Quality of decor, room size, free wifi, ticket printing, complimentary drinks, sauna etc all above expectation for the location and price.

We visit many hotels as a family and this one beats main stream four star hotels. Very highly recommended.

review.title: A great place for a SF holiday
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a brilliant location. Staff were friendly and helpful, room was large, clean and comfortable. I had one of the rooms with a terrace which was very charming and a nice place for a glass of wine in the evening. Hotel is one block back from Union Square and within easy walking distance of Chinatown, the Italian quarter, SFMOMA and great shops. I spent 6 nights here and would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to San Francisco. The price is right, the location is fantastic and the hotel is very comfortable.

review.title: loved this hotel
review.reviewText: this hotel is in the heart of the city Union Square its easy to get to all the muni lines and the Bart system. we were able to walk to restuarants for breakfast each morning we recommend Honey Honey just down the street for a good breakfast and light dinner of crepes Happy Hour too. fino's was a good fine to dinner was great

review.title: Very Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: The staff at this hotel was outstanding. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The location is very convenient to dining, China Town, and shopping. Overall, I would recommend staying at this hotel. The parking is a little expensive, but it is valet and extremely convenient.

review.title: Donatello Hotel San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was booked for three adults and we were more than impressed with the room and facilities. Also in a very convenient location. All hotel staff encountered were very pleasant and helpful.

review.title: Quiet and comfortable
review.reviewText: The hotel is located at center of the city. The staff were very helpful. The kitchen utensils in the room provided convenience and comfort to travelers. It would be better if there is a desk in the room and the complimentary internet connection could have been faster.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText:
The Donatello is in a great location. greatservice.
The downside is due to its location it is very noisyfrom 4am each mornig with traffic andutility vehicles
very central for all sights

review.title: Great Location and lovely hotel
review.reviewText: the hotel was first class and we found no faults. Superb location, lovelly surroundings, very friendly and helpful staff

review.title: A great stay
review.reviewText: We stayed in the Dinatello for 10 days and we really liked it. We got free Wi Fi in the rooms which worked for a few days but then if we wanted to use it we would have to go to the lobby, which was a bit of a pain especially as we travelled with 2 teenage kids. On one of the days the hot water wasn't working so we couldn't shower, that was another pain but that was it. The hotel was really clean, the room service came round every day which was brill and the bed was brill, the kids slept on a bed satee, which was fine. Staff were so nice, we were greeted each time we were in the lobby. They had a bar with piano and live singer each evening, which was great and a happy hour each evening. There was a coffee machine and coffee left each day, there was a fridge and iron which came in really handy. Over all, really liked it, would recommend this hotel

review.title: "Pleasant stay and looking forward to going back"
review.reviewText: The Donatello was nice surprise and what sets it apart from the other hotels is the friendly staff. Great service as we were even greeted by the manager on several occasions. The concierge was very helpful giving us directions. The Club room was a plus with a small exercise facility, locker room, steam room, and a jacuzzi. A lounge is located on the top floor with a nice view of the city and to top it off free Peets coffee, tea or hot chocolate that was available. This added a nice touch as you could sit down, unwind, read the paper or watch the T.V. while enjoying your coffee. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and we are looking forward into going back.

review.title: 90% Great, 10% Awful
review.reviewText:
A great location, and a reasonable rate for a very clean, and comfortable room.

Arriving Friday night, we were offered a choice of rooms and selected a corner room overlooking Post Street. We were advised at the front desk about the noise level on that side of the hotel, but we took our chances in order to have the better view. The view (8th floor) was very impressive, and so was the noise. Unless you plan to party all night at Ruby Skye, the techno club across the street, you will deal with noise in your room until 3 am, and then at 6:30 am you will wake to the sound of thousands of liquor bottles being dumped. Don't they have back doors for this?

We booked an "Unlimited Wi-Fi" rate. The Wi-Fi didn't work through most of our two-night stay. The staff was as helpful as possible, but not always capable. They called "Maintenance" who struggled to correct the situation, but it was a constant battle. Maybe it's a small point, but this is San Francisco - not a small underdeveloped village. Don't advertise a "Wi-Fi" rate if you can't deliver.

Donatello is a good stay, with friendly staff, and it has a great location - but look around. The friends we were meeting in SF found a nicer room at a better rate only two blocks away.

review.title: Great location + comfort + staff + medium cost = Donatello
review.reviewText:
A block away from Union Square, in the best location and with a great staff. Clean, affordable, comfortable, feels like home.
A hidden gem.

review.title: Every thing we had hoped for.
