review.reviewText: We have returned to SF many times. It is always a wonderful experience. Right up there with Barcelona and Prague as a SPECIAL place. We have taken note of the Donatello on previous visits to the city but never stayed there. This time we did. What a good choice. When ever we go to California we do so with high expectations. The Donatello did not disappoint ! Seldom have we been in a hotel where the staff seemed so eager to make things pleasant for a guest.. Ready smiles at the front desk and from the bellmen. [The Concierge could take a lesson from them.] A delightful and extraordinarily friendly little bar. Good jazz. Good drinks. A large and well kept room--flooded with sunshine. Would we go back? Yes, indeed. Would we recommend it to friends? We already have.

review.title: Better than all expected
review.reviewText: This hotel was a bit of a gem. We needed an extra two nights accommodation before staying at the Westin St Francis and this hotel was far better across the board. Better room, great and handy location - we would have no hesitation booking at the Donatello again. The room was spacious and much less pretentious than the Westin.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The Donatello is a nice hotel. The rooms and hallways are a little dated, but clean and nice overall. Good location with shopping and restaurants. Easy to get to interstate for day trips to wine country. Under a $10 cab ride to the Wharf. If you do not want to stay in a chain hotel when visiting San Francisco this is a good choice. Parking is expensive so do without a car if you can. There is a Hertz around the corner. We would stay again.

review.title: Very comfortable!
review.reviewText: Overall, our stay was great. It is in a prime location, the people were really really friendly (Ed at the front desk was super helpful) and our room had a lovely terrace and was spacious, clean and comfortable. The only hiccups was at the beginning of our stay when we had to switch rooms because the pull out sofa in our room wasn't fit to be slept in which was a little peculiar as we had booked for 3 people.. but nevertheless all in all we had a great weeks stay in our new room. The second was the fact that they don't have a scale available for guests so we had to take 9 pieces of luggage up to the 15th floor to weigh them in the gym. But again, when considering the overall comfort of the room and such, this wouldn't really alter the rating from a solid 8/10. I'd definitely return!

review.title: excellent customer care
review.reviewText: see above

review.title: Will go back next year
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel well located good service will go back next year

review.title: Affortable at a great location
review.reviewText: Room was clean and comfortable. It even had mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker, set of silverware, and a sink in the room. Room service was also very good. It is located 2 blocks from Union Square and close to subway line.

review.title: Good Value in Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Very pleased with the hotel particularly its location being a block away from Union Square. The room was very comfortable and whilst were aware of
the noise from the street it was something we felt was a problem
The room facilities were very good(fridge etc)

review.title: brilliant hotel right in the centre
review.reviewText: wonderful friendly service, comfortable rooms, brilliant location

review.title: Hotel was awesome.
review.reviewText: Would return to hotel. Staff was very friendly, helpful and professional. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Location was great.

review.title: Great hotel for family with small child
review.reviewText:
The Donatello was very accommodating for our family. We asked (And received) a hotel room on one of the upper floors, to ensure it was quiet for our daughter.
The room was clean, and my daughter was always surprised to see the bedding turned down at night with a mint on our pillow!
It was in a terrific location for visiting San Francisco - easy to walk places, easy to get on public transportation, great restaurants nearby.

We enjoyed our stay and would come back.

review.title: A great hotel, Excellent value for money
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel, we found it excellent value for money with being right in the centre of San Francisco shopping and easy access to all other areas of San Francisco. The rooms are large and very clean, tidy and the furnishings lovely it was wonderful to have the little kitchenette area with everything that you could need provided (i.e. cutlery, plates and dishes ECT) which we made good use of and saved money on not eating out so much. The staff in the hotel were very friendly and most helpful with any requests which we had........all in all great hotel would stop there again......P.S. don’t forget to go to the top floor where tea, coffee, mini snacks and newspapers are all free of charge to all guests.

review.title: Decent hotel - big Rooms for San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel, good size rooms. Coffee on top floor is good. Gym small but quite well equipped. No pool but the jacuzzi worked well (also on top floor).
Fridge, Microwave & small kitchen sink tucked behind an alcove (not in the middle of the room as usual so that's a plus!)
Parking is typical San Fran Expensive. You can save 3-4 bucks a day parking next door on "hotel special"

review.title: Convenient to Downtown
review.reviewText:
Stayed at The Donatello for 7 nights August 2010 and was greeted from the front door with courteous & efficient service. The room was a King suite at the end of the corridor and even though next to service & ice maker was never disturbed by these. Room was clean & bright with full width window. Bed was extremely comfortable and having a kitchenette allowed ability to have simple food instead of restaurant meal. Had in room meal one night from restaurant which was delivered in reasonable time frame and was delicious.
Concierge service on top floor was excellent with bookings and information requests no trouble. One block from Union Square (hop on/off bus pickup & shops), couple blocks from Cable Car terminus or Chinatown. Thoroughly recommend - will go back.

review.title: Will return
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very well located, near plenty of good cafes for brekky & restaurants for dinner. It is also handy to the financial district.

However, it is a little tired, the rooms have noisy plumbing & need more maintenance. This is somewhat offset by very friendly staff, from the front desk to the housemaids.

I strongly recommend the bar area, great jazz music with a nice feel.

review.title: Downtown SFO's Best Kept Secret
review.reviewText: The hotel was better than we expected and was a perfect location. We would definitely stay there again. Easy access to everything in downtown SFO, one block from cable car stop, right down from the wharf, and easy access to the freeways to Napa Valley, Muir Woods, Santa Rosa, etc. It was the perfect place to stay for our quick 4 day trip.

review.title: Clean but getting old and run-down.
review.reviewText:
Good points: Convenient location. Clean room. Comfortable (firm) King bed.

Not so good: Air con very noisy and does nothing. Bathroom extractor fan hardly working. Blobs of silicon sealar all round edge of sink where it joins vanity. Some paint and woodwork damage. Street noise through single glazed windows.

Bad point (for me): Toilet bowl kept filling with water to a level where you could get an unwanted and unhygenic bidet experience if seated. (More of a male problem than female for obvious reasons!)

Did we complain? - No
Why not? - Only there for three nights and only to sleep after big day out being tourists. If they had a better room why would they not give it to us in the first place. Couldn't be bothered re-packing or haggling with staff.

review.title: Lovely central SF hotel
review.reviewText:
Friendly staff, huge rooms. Handy fridge with small microwave and a 'wet bar' style sink, coffee maker. Some street noise even on the 7th floor as the windows are not double glazed. Bathroom a little dated, but functional. Maid service is efficient and rooms cleaned well. Wifi nice and fast.

Location is excellent with Union Square shopping minutes away. Check out the "Bristol Farm" food store in the SF Westfield centre for healthy food.

Some homeless/ beggars on surrounding blocks. I would recommend walking to Union Sq via Post Street. Local convenience stores v expensive, but head for Walgreens on Market St for supplies!

review.title: A great place to stay
review.reviewText: Our experience was delightful. We were checked into hotel by Bobby who was so pleasant and very helpful. We were so pleased with the room as it was huge with windows all along the outer wall. The bed was large and very comfortable. The kitchenette was ideal for breakfast. We did like the top floor where we could help ourselves to tea and coffee right up to 10.30pm each day. The concierge who is there all day was most helpful. Also the daily newspapers were available as well. The staff were all very helpful and courteous. The location of the hotel was excellent, about a 2 minute walk to Union Square. It could be noisy due to bin lorries etc in the morning but it was not a problem. We will definitely stay in the Donatello when we next visit San Francisco.

review.title: Love the Donatello in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The Donatello is a great choice in San Francisco. It's small and intimate, the rooms are very spacious and modern, it's immaculate, and the service was as good as it gets.
I'd stay there again, and, since my daughter lives three blocks away, I'm sure I will.

review.title: Won't Stay Here Again
review.reviewText:
While the location is great and the staff very friendly, there were a couple of things that soured us on the Donatello and we will not be back. At check-in, we were told that the next night there would be wine & appetizers. When we went, however, and after we were eating and drinking, we noticed a sign saying there was $5 charge, including children. We would not object to paying - the wine and food were terrific - what we object to, is not being told.

Also, we paid for a room with two beds, since we had our 5 year-old with us. Walking into our room there was only one bed. The bellman told us that the sofa was a hide-a-bed. Not what we were expecting, but okay. So, we return after turn-down service and the sofa bed is not made up. We had to call housekeeping and have someone come up. Each night after that, we left the bed out all day - and at turn down service, no mints on that bed. Not a big deal for adults maybe, but a huge deal for a kid. It was obvious there were two beds in there.

We were not impressed with The Donatello, cannot recommend it and will not be returning.

review.title: The Donatello in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
My son had stayed there and thought we would like it so we booked there.
The service, the attention, the comfort, the location, all 10 points.
We will go back to San Freancisco and when we The Donatello will be our first choice.
Could not be happier.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We didn't have a car, so parking was not an issue. Within 2 blocks of Union Square and 5 blocks to Powell St BART. My daughter checked in first and I arrived the next day. She's vegetarian and loved the convenience of the mini kitchen(micro and frig) so she could fix her own food if needed. Front desk suggested lots of good restaurants nearby..one a Thai place that she enjoyed. She's also very picky about cleanliness and had no complaints about the room or hotel. We enjoyed the club level floor with coffee and she used the hot tub/jacuzzi..again no complaints about not being clean. Our only comment was that we were at the end of a hall which was next to the service closet. We thought it would be noisy, but it really wasn't an issue as we were gone during the days.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Good location, close to public transportation hub.

review.title: Great Location! Near All!
review.reviewText: The Donatello was a nice hotel, friendly staff, and comfortable. The lady who sang in the bar at night was outstanding. This hotel is really close to Union Square and that's where all the action is. The only complaint we had was our first night -we didn't get any sleep. Our room was on the side of the hotel near a really LOUD nightclub... the noise and talking didn't stop until around 4:00am. We asked to switch our room to the other side of the hotel the next night and they were very accommodating. That night we slept great! So, just a warning, try to get a room away from the loud night club. Unless of course you will be joining the people at the night club and don't care.

review.title: Great overall
review.reviewText: Great room at a reasonable price. Close to several of SF's attractions and BART.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel
review.reviewText: The Donatello was in a great neighborhood and had big rooms with a kitchenette. Free coffee, tea, and hot chocolate is available upstairs in the lounge. It was a classy place, but affordable, and I plan to stay here on my next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Donatello
review.reviewText: My wife and I travelled to San Francisco on 2/19 to be with our son and his family as they waited for the arrival of their second child (born on 3/1). We stayed with our son until 3/9 when the second set of grandparents moved in and we moved to the Donatello. We've stayed at several hotels in San Francisco including the Fairmont and the Westin St. Francis and I can't say that either of those was materially a better stay than the Donatello. The room was spacious, clean, well serviced, and the club room (for coffee, tea, a paper, etc.) provided a nice way to finish up the day. We spent one day shopping and found the hotel very conveniently located. We also used the Muni to go to our son's house and that too was very convenient. We certainly will consider staying here in the future when we visit San Francisco.

review.title: A good value well situated
review.reviewText:
Ideally situated close to Union Square, friendly staff, comfortable rooms reasonably spacious.Parking next door for 28$ a day.
I tried the restaurant for dinner, good italian cuisine reasonably priced.
The only thing I did not like is no breakfast at the hotel restaurant (Plenty of places around the hotel)

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The Donatello offers a wonderful location---Union Square for shopping, many good restaurants you can walk to. The hotel also offers valet parking that is slightly less than public parking. The concierge is wonderful--a fountain of information. Room rates are a very good value.

review.title: Sleep Deprived
review.reviewText: I always stayed at hotels at the Union Square when visiting SF. This was the only time that I experienced problems with noises. The hotel is situated near a night club and it was extremely noisy in the weekend (Friday and Saturday) evenings. Sunday evening was fine. On a positive note, the room is spacious and comfortable for me and my two adult daughters.

review.title: Will be staying again!
review.reviewText: My stay at the Dontello was wonderful. We arrived early an was given a room immediately. I asked for a room on the upper floors because I am a light sleeper. The top club floor is a great place to relax have coffee and read the paper. Friday, there was wine and chesse, I won the raffle!! Dinner at the Italian place connected to the hotel was excellent, the piano player made it even more special. Close to the Muni and cable cars. Will defintiely go back!!

review.title: Not exactly for business travelers
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the Donatello for 3 nights. Check-in was smooth. The room was terrific with one glaring exception - there was no desk. What was positioned as a desk was actually a very small make-up/dressing table with about a 24 x 30 inch surface. How can a supposedly 4 star hotel in a major business hub have rooms without a desk? On the plus side, the bathroom was fine, wireless internet was flawless (and free), the room was spacious and the mattress was terrific. A minor down side was that there was a flat screen TV but it was an off-brand with a very finicky remote. And why upgrade the set if the signal is still low def?

The neighborhood from the hotel toward Union Square was fine. Going left/west out of the htel, it goes downhill very fast into seedy at best.

review.title: Excellent experience
review.reviewText: A quiet, friendly atmosphere, near Union Square

review.title: Delightful Hotel at Union Square
review.reviewText:
Large room with all amenities and very confortable bed. Windows actually open to the street if you need some city sounds (can be noisy if you face the street).
Service was excellent.
Great location for walking around that part of town.
Good restaurants and bars all around the hotel.

review.title: Great hotel with beautiful lounge on the roof
review.reviewText: For business travel, this hotel has a lot to offer. Free internet was slightly slow, but fully accessable. Lounge area on the roof offers coffee, tea and pop, light back ground music, stunning views of the Union Square area and mountains. An outside area to view the surrounding area or enjoy the sunshine. The parking garage is convenient, especially for local business associates to park and have a meeting in the lounge. Wonderful.

review.title: Nice Stay
review.reviewText: We were very happy with this hotel. The room was clean, comfortable and roomy. The staff was friendly & helpful. Has a nice piano bar, perfect for after dinner drinks.

review.title: Would return to The Donatello...but bring your ear plugs
review.reviewText: The Donatello is in a wonderfully convenient location in the Union Square area. However, you have to be willing to put up with street noise late at night due to garbage trucks and loud/rowdy young folks at the nightclub across the street. My earplugs blocked most of the noise, but my husband did not use them and suffered. Despite that, he said he would definitely return.The hotel itself is very comfortable and the rooms are BIG and comfortable. The staff is great.

review.title: Christine
review.reviewText: Absolutely LOVED the Donatello. I can't wait to go back.

review.title: Very Disappointed
review.reviewText: Although the Donatello is in a very convenient location, and the rooms were fundamentally clean and comfortable, the basic service was very disappointing. First, the website promoted a complimentary breakfast which turned out to be a very meager motel-style continental breakfast for a charge of $7 per person. My advice - walk a block to any of the diners down the street for a much better deal. Second, a stop at the concierge desk for a promised "welcome package" was actually an opportunity for the hotel to try to up-sell its timeshare program. I found this shocking and insulting. Third, on a raining morning, the hotel would not call me a taxi, and after a half-hearted attempt to hail one, gave up and told me I was on my own. I ended up walking two blocks in the rain to the Hilton where the doorman gladly hailed me a cab. Overall, I was stunned by the poor and insulting service at the Donatello, and I won't be back.

review.title: Can't Wait to go back to San Fran and the Donatello!
review.reviewText: Perfect location! We walked to Union Square, took the transit and even walked to Fisherman's Wharf! Everyone at the Donatella were friendly! We used the Club: fitness room, played cards, got our coffee each morning and chatted with the concierge. The rooms were spacious, had refrig, microwave, all dishes, utensils! Perfect!!! Added pleasure: turndown service w/delicious chocolate each evening!

review.title: Wonderful staff, wonderful location
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel, the staff, and the location. Very centrally located to everything we wanted to see and do in San Fran. The only negative about the room was that the windows didn't seem sealed very well and we heard some of noise outside throughout the night. Every staff person that we dealt with at the hotel were an absolute pleasure to deal with. We'd stay here again without hesitation.

review.title: loved it
review.reviewText: great location,great service,loved the mini kitchen,great value

review.title: Comfort and value in a central location
review.reviewText: We used the Donatello for three nights, on arrival from UK and whilst waiting to pick up an RV. I chose this hotel on the basis of comments by other guests on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. The staff on Reception were very friendly and happy to give advice on getting the best out of our short stay. The bedroom was huge (as was the bathroom) and had a kitchenette of sink, microwave, fridge and coffee maker. The on-line rate seemed excellent value, as it included continental breakfast. this has recently been improved - it is now served on the mezzanine floor alongside the restaurant, so there is a better supply of fruit, cereal and savouries to supplement the pastries and coffee. The hotel is just one block from Union Square, which reduces the noise, and a short walk (even with wheeled cases) from the BART and the cable car terminus. A good location for sight-seeing, as you can go north to Fisherman's Wharf on the cable car and then come back via the trams along the coast.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: Location was good, comfort of rooms good and staff friendly and helpful

review.title: very happy
review.reviewText: we had a great time staying at the donatello. the room was comfy and clean, also it has a mini kitchen; sink, microwave, fridge, dishes and cutlery. this was very useful when u were traveling on a budget! the staff was very helpful and polite. the location coudnt be more perfect, it was next to union sq. we would definitely go back again!

review.title: Really Impressed
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel with great rooms for a bargain price.

review.title: 100% RECOMENDED
review.reviewText: THE DONATELLO IS REALLY WELL LOCATED, JUST ONE BLOCK FROM UNION SQUARE AND NEAR BUSES AND CABLE CARS STOPS. THE HOTEL IS VERY COMFORTABLE AND THE SERVICE IS GREAT. I DEFINATELY WOULD GET BACK TO THE DONATELLO.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, great location-will return!
review.reviewText: We live in the Bay Area & have stayed in numerous downtown SF hotels. Our room at The Donatello was clean,comfortable & spacious. It was myself & 2 teenage girls (they have lots of baggage!) but we had plenty of room. The beds were very comfortable. Great location for shopping & restaurants galore - we walked everywhere. Will definitely stay here again!

review.title: A Warm Welcome
review.reviewText: We stayed at The Donatello for four nights in July and were very pleased with all aspects of our stay. The staff were, without exception, efficient and obliging, knowledgeable about their city and very friendly. The hotel is smart and clean, the rooms stylish and spacious and cleaned with beds made up every day. A comfortable sofa bed means that rooms can accommodate up to four adults. Breakfast is a happily chaotic affair (don't expect flunkeys serving everything with tongs) with very tasty continental style foods - croissants, muffins, pastries, fruit - and enough coffee to satisfy even the thirstiest. The meal is taken in a room at the top of the hotel - you can sit outside when it's fine - and you sit where you can. It can be busy so those who are morose at the breakfast table might like to take their share back to their rooms. We thoroughly enjoyed our time at the hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Stayed with my family. Centrally located to everything and great rooms for families.

review.title: good value, great location
review.reviewText: great location. free Internet, clean and spacious room.nice breakfast.k staff very helpful they can book you any kind of activity you need from a tour to a restaurant. good value. highly recommended. only thing i didn't like is the charge for parking. they as for 28$ a day when you can park down the street for 15$.

review.title: Showing its age
review.reviewText: I think the D is showing its age. Rooms need some serious redecorating and the service staff could use some training in current hotel service and support not the way it was 10 years ago. Movies would be nice also. Can't remember the last time I stayed at a hotel of 3 star or above that didn't have movies to purchase. And their "wireless internet" was too weak to get a signal. I actually went on-line using the signal from a nearby Kimpton (I'm a Kimpton In-Touch member so have userID and password) that was 4 times stronger and worked great. Having stayed before, this time was a disappointment.

review.title: Nice Hotel, conveniently located
review.reviewText: The Donatello was a wonderful place to stay. Great location, friendly staff. My only complaint was the WiFi service was slow as molasses when it worked at all.

review.title: Nice boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Love staying here; the rooms are good-sized and comfortable. Having a microwave, refrigerator, and toaster, (and the coffeepot of course) is a plus, especially if you want to store perishables or have breakfast in the room without paying room services prices. The hotel is now owned by a vacation-resort company and they do try to to sell you on that, but it's easily sidestepped. A few spots could have used a new coat of paint.

review.title: Did Not Meet My Expectations
review.reviewText: This hotel has a lot of assets - its location is really great, it was affordable during my stay, and the room was large and comfortable. However, I choose this hotel from among other similarly-priced options for 2 primary reasons: free internet and "included" continental breakfast - since these are both expenses that can add up after several days. The free wireless internet was free, but the reception in my room was weak and occasionally unavailable. The "included" continental breakfast actually costs $4.00. That's not expensive, but it's not an impressive continental and I felt as though their advertising was dishonest in that the breakfast was not free. Finally, because the Donatello is a "Shell Vacation Property," we were subjected to a rather strong sales pitch from the concierge to attend a time share presentation during our visit.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The Donatello has well-appointed rooms, friendly and helpful staff, and a great location. The facility is well-kept and clean. We would definitely stay in this hotel on another visit.

review.title: Perfect Hotel and Location!
review.reviewText: The room was sooooo spacious and clean, with windows all along one side, view of street/Union Square. Loved the frig/microwave/coffee area, with plates & utensils for eating in. We had a sofa, sitting area that made the room for 3 very comfortable. We'd return in a minute! Also, the concierge & registration staff were all above expectations!!

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: My husband, son and I stayed at the Donatello on a recent stay in San Fransisco. This was my first time in San Fransisco, so we loved being a block away from the trolley car stop which took us straight down to Fisherman's Wharf. The location was unbeatable! Chinatown, shopping, restaurants all within a short walk or trolley car ride. We had a nice king sized bed with a sleeper sofa in our room for our son. The room wasn't huge, but a nice size for downtown San Fransisco! The Donatello is an excellent small boutique hotel in a prime location and we found a great rate through Expedia!

review.title: Excellent hotel with great location
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed the hotel. The breakfast was adequate and the staff was very helpful. The only complaint that I would have is that the hotel is affiliated with the Shell Vacation Club and they'll try to get you to attend a meeting to explain the program to you. The "welcome gift" is just a way to get you to come down and have the concierge try to talk you into this. We got several phone calls from the concierge trying to get us to attend. We would still go back there--we would just tell them we weren't interested so they wouldn't bother us about it.

review.title: Great service and great location!
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and efficient. They went out of their way to assure comfort and satisfaction. The room was clean and attended carefully each day of my five-day stay. I highly recommend this hotel to visitors to San Francisco.

review.title: best valuse for money hotel
review.reviewText: i was very satisfied with every thing only the break fast could have had more items and the lady sarah at the concierge should be more honest and warm over all absoltley it is value for money

review.title: Recommended Hotel
review.reviewText: No problems encountered. Staff friendly and helpful.

review.title: A good stay for the price
review.reviewText: My wife and I and our 4 year old spent 4 nights at the Donatello recently. The location was superb (easily walked to union square and market street) and the rooms were quite spacious. The included continental breakfast was a little dissappointing as they only had muffins and donuts for food and juice or coffee. We had to take our food back to our room because that lounge had almost no chairs. There was some wear and tear in the bathroom but nothing that was gross. When we arrived, we were asked to visit their company's office by the pier to sit through a time share oppurtunity to get some free city passes or food certificates. We didn't feel like it, but there are probably some options for those who have time on their hands. Overall for the price we paid, I couldn't have asked for more. It was a perfect base of operations to get around all of San Fran's sights.

review.title: Excellant location, great value, very spacious!
review.reviewText: Great location in Union Square. Was within walking to shopping, resturants, cable cars. Concierge staff was extremely helpful. Rooms were really large with nice furnishings. Great Value!

review.title: Comfort and proximity to shopping centers
review.reviewText: We stayed in Donatello for 4 days and we love the comfort and feeling of not away from home. The room is big and has a everything you need the moment you wake up. Shopping is only a stone throw away and needless to say the staff are good and attentive to our needs. I will give Donatello a 5 Star rating and will surely be back for our next trip in 2011.

review.title: Great when you don't want to drive home!
review.reviewText: Gracious welcome, comfortable room, adequate breakfast, terrific concierge. Nice spot to stay in town after an evening "on the town" when driving wouldn't be a good idea.

review.title: NIce hotel
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel with a good location. I especially liked the mini-fridge and microwave in my room. The room was spacious and had a desk and a couch. I would definately stay again. My only complaints were that my room was right next to the ice machine and service door so that produced noise all day and night. Also I went for 1/2 off apps at the bar and although they were tasty they were such small portions, it must be half off and half size.

review.title: In the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: A pleasant hotel for the price. Helpful staff. Wish they had earlier continental breakfast for the earlier airport departures.

review.title: Great Hotel in Perfect Location
review.reviewText: This is a wonderful hotel with large clean rooms and a very friendly and helpful staff. It is perfectly located one block from Union Square and the cable car stop. It also had a nice complimentary continental breakfast.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The room was adequate, however it was by no means a "king suite" as described. For 2 adults and a small child, there was barely enough room to function. The noise level from the street was atrocious - obviously no or very little sound proofing. On our last night there, there was a party in one of the community rooms (no warning to us) and the music/bass was so loud we couldn't even hold a conversation in our room from 4pm-10pm. Also, the maintenance was borderline - we couldn't use the stopper on the bathtub as it was bolted in an upright position (wonderful when traveling with young children!) and the fan for the a/c unit rattled 90% of the time. The strengths were that the staff is friendly and helpful, and its convenient to Union Square and walking distance to good transportation on Muni/Bart.

review.title: excellent hotel, excellent location
review.reviewText: A real gem of a hotel with rooms larger than you could expect in San Francisco. Had a de luxe king room that had lounge and dining area and wet bar, plus dressing room, and of course en suite facilities. Breakfast in the The Donatello club on the top floor was more than adequate (and included in price as was free internet access)and the hotel staff were both friendly and very helpful. Location for shopping and business excellent and just a few steps from the cable cars

review.title: Very Pleased
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the location of the hotel and the comfort offered by the room.The hotel personnel is to be commended for getting out of there way help us.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the stay. The service was great and the staff very helpful. It will be the first to check out when returning to San Francisco.

review.title: Great Location and Great Price
review.reviewText: The rooms were much larger than I was expecting. Rooms were clean, service was amazing. The Continental Breakfast was great, and the location put you very close to all of the amazing restaurants in Union Square, near Chinatown, and right by the Cable Car line.

review.title: Great good value hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is perfectly located for Union Sq and easily in reach of all transport links to all areas of San Fran. The room was spacious and spotless with a massive bed and all necessary mod cons, including a small kitchenette. Staff throughout the hotel were fab and couldn't be more helpful. I was celebrating my 30th Birthday and the staff kindly sent up a bottle of Champayne, sweets and chocolates which was kind. Great advise was provided on eating out and trips, all in all great service. Also loved the spa.

review.title: Great location, decent value
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed in the Donatello for four nights in March 2009. The front desk was very helpful and courteous and we loved our room. We were on the 5th floor and while other reviews have complained about the noise on that floor we had no trouble. In fact, the lovely thing about the 5th floor is that we had our own private patio with a table and chairs and lovely succulents all around. We also thoroughly enjoyed having a little fridge and sink and other kitchen amenities. My only complaints would be that while the rest of the room was delightfully modern, the bathroom could definitely use some updating. The shower was less than stellar and I wouldn't have wanted to take a bath in the tub. However, since I don't spend much time in the bath or the shower it really wasn't that big of a deal. Also, we enjoyed the breakfast and the free coffee on the club level, but were really put off by the head concierge who treated us (for days) as if we were trying to get away with something--like a free cup of coffee. Each time we went for coffee he snootily asked for our room and made us sign in--even if we had already been up there three times. Eh, no big deal, but kind of irritating. Overall, however, this is a charming hotel close to Chinatown and all the shopping anyone could want.

review.title: Great place in center of town
review.reviewText: Staff is very attentive and the restaurants are within walking distance

review.title: good experience
review.reviewText: it was a good experience except for the parking issue... never herd of a hotel charging for parking!!!

review.title: Excellent Value 1 block from Union Square
review.reviewText: The Donatello is a very comfortable, smaller hotel 1 block off of Union square, close to most major theaters, shopping, and many excellent restaurants. The rooms are spacious, clean, and appeared recently remodeled. The color combination in the room was somewhat loud for our tastes but the sizable room with a couch, sitting area, desk, refrigerator and in-room safe was extremely comfortable and met all of our needs. Continental breakfast--included in the price of the room--was adequate and was kept well stocked. The club room on the top floor is a nice place to lounge, read the paper, or have a drink. Staff is friendly and eager to assist.

review.title: Excellent Hotel and Location
review.reviewText: We found the hotel location, rooms and staff excellent. We will return and recommend the hotel for short and long-term visitors.

review.title: Great location, comfortable room
review.reviewText: I stayed four nights and really enjoyed the Donatello, which had continental breakfast, a (small) workout room, and a mini-kitchen with real wine glasses and champagne glasses! The only drawbacks were (1) a call the first morning from the concierge, asking me to stop by to pick up my "welcome package," which was merely a sales pitch for organized tours around the city, and (2) one night I ate at the restaurant associated with the hotel, having been drawn in by an ad in my room promising "live music" on Sundays. There was no music, however, and I thought the meal was only so-so for the prices. Overall, though, I really liked this hotel and would stay there again.

review.title: Nice hotel!
review.reviewText: Can not think of anything bad about this hotel. We were satisfied w/ everything.

review.title: Hotel Donatello - good value for price
review.reviewText: great location - close to Union Square shopping and cable cars. Room was nice - beds were comfortable including the pull-out couch. Bathroom was clean and modern. Continental breakfast was good. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Too much noise
review.reviewText: The noise from next room waked up me.... The wall between room was thin. Except for that, this hotel was comfortable.

review.title: large rooms, decent breakfast, but lacking customer service...
review.reviewText: Pros: large rooms, comfortable bed, small kitchenette, good breakfast. Cons: mold on the shower walls, I forgot my comb so i went downstairs to ask for one and the guy at the desk looked at me as if my request was crazy and curtly replied "no", no view, gym (which is very small) doesn't open until 7 a.m., which is late for most business travelers.

review.title: I recommend this hotel
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this property many times and this time was by far the best. The staff was very accommodating from the front desk to the bell desk. It's so convenient to Union Square and the theaters. We love having a microwave and a refrigerator in the room. Sometimes the nightclub across the street can get a little noisy, but generally only on the weekends.

review.title: Great Hotel Great Location!
review.reviewText: I would reccommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in a central location in one of the best cities in the world.

review.title: excellent hotel
review.reviewText: excellet hotel,good location

review.title: Location Amazing
review.reviewText: Hotel is a short walk away from Union Square and central to downtown. Fantastic to be so close to great shops and restaurants. Continental breakfast nothing special but plenty of options nearby hotel instead.

review.title: Great place for a vacation
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a great location, concierge service was helpful. Clean, spacious room. Very friendly staff. Terrific value with the continental breakfast.

review.title: Excellent Hotel - Extremely BAD flight
review.reviewText: Firstly San Fran & The Hotel Donatello were excellent, the Hotel was one block away from Union Square and therefore near everything we needed to get around ie. Tram line, BART and Muni system. We did experience some disco noise on the saturday night but it didn't stop us from sleeping (7th floor)The Pastry breakfast was a nice addition as most hotels do not offer anything in their price. You could also get free tea, coffee, hot chocolate throughout the day & evening if you wished in the Club lounge. Also the small gym, jacuzzi & Sauna were a nice extra. The room was just as described, very clean and a great bed. The spoil of our trip was the United flight we had been squashed into, we were booked on a BMI flight which was joined with lots of other companies to fill the one United Flight. The Jumbo must have been as old as the Ark, firstly we were sat separately as they had taken to many bookings for the one flight, there were no TV screens anywhere in coach so they pulled down one cloth screen at the front of the section and that was it - we were finally put together near the back of the plane so had no chance of seeing the screen without binoculars!!!! 11 hours of nothing in a cramped seat - not a pleasant start to the journey. Our return journey was slightly better as we did get moved to Economy plus.

review.title: perfect location
review.reviewText: We used public transportation for our entire week and the Donatello was in a perfect spot. Close to train, bus and steetcar. There was diner style restaurant a block away which was had good food. The morning continental breakfast at the Donatello was always well stocked when we got there at about 7:30. There was coffee and tea available in the evening. The room was large and very comfortable. The front desk, the concierge desk and the maid service were always friendly and willing to help with any questions or needs. We were very pleased.

review.title: Brilliant
review.reviewText: All excellent - but very basic breakfast in crowded room

review.title: Nice hotel, but avoid rooms on the 5th floor.
review.reviewText: My neice and I recently stayed at the Donatello, and we liked the hotel but were shocked by the noise outside our door on our first night -- kids running and crying, drunken adults yelling. It turns out that there is a banquet/meeting room on the same floor as guest rooms! When I called to complain, the man at the desk said he'd never had a complaint such as mine (hard to believe) and offered to move us. Since it was almost 10:00 PM and we'd showered and unpacked, we didn't want to move. He sent someone us to close the door to the banquet room (?), in hopes of keeping in the noise I guess. Well, it didn't help much, and when the banquet room emptied, all the occupants had to walk past the guest rooms to get to the elevator -- so even more noise. Honestly, though, the hotel is nice, clean and located a block from Union Square. The staff was great, too -- not their fault someone thought banquet rooms and guest rooms were a good combo. So, I recommend the hotel, but advise you to request a new room if they try to put you on the 5th floor.

review.title: Great place to stay, would recommend
review.reviewText: We had a great experience at the Donatello hotel. Everything I had seen and read on their website was completely accurate. Our rooms were a lot bigger than other hotels I had looked in to prior to booking at the Donatello. Our view wasn't the greatest but we were away from the street so didn't have an issue with the noise as I had read from other reviewers. The location was perfect - right in the heart of Union Square and close to the trains/cable cars. When booking, I didn't realize there was a hot tub on the top floor...what a bonus after walking up and down those San Francisco hills all day long! We also took advantage of the Continental breakfast (also on the top floor, with a great view.) It was nice to enjoy a free breakfast since we were spending so much in the city for lunch and dinner.

review.title: Donatello Hotel - fab hotel Union Sq
review.reviewText: We previously stayed at another nearby hotel by Union Square as we quite like boutique hotels and love the location, and the Donatello is literally across the street. What a pleasant surprise, the staff are superb, friendly and efficient, the surroundings in both the club lounge(with complimentary continental breakfast on the roof - fab) and public areas are beautiful and yet intimate, everything is sparkling clean and the rooms are big, quiet and furnished to an excellent standard with (unusually for SF) a half kitchen containing coffee maker and a fridge. We became aware that the rooms are part-owned (timescare) but we weren't pushed even once to "join". Free net in the lobby. Excellent value, we will definitiely come again.

review.title: Did they give the staff happy pills?
review.reviewText: My traveling companions & I asked jokingly "Do they feed the hotel workers happy pills?" They were great. We stayed in a room with a king bed & a pull out couch - it was HUGE ... bigger then my friends studio that lives in the city! Great staff! Great Location! Loved it!

review.title: I will come back to the Donatello,no doubt.
review.reviewText: Well located,two blocks from Union Sq.,quite warm and helping hotel employees,nice accomodations.

review.title: Have already recommended it to a friend
review.reviewText: Loved the location. Rooms are large. Even had kitchen equipment which would be nice for tourists looking to save money on eating out.

review.title: Good room, great location, friendly staff
review.reviewText: We spent 3 nights in San Francisco at the tail end of a trip through California, Arizona and Nevada. We booked a triple room for me, my husband and 15 year old son and we weren't disappointed by the size of our room, which included a massive queen size bed and a comfortable sofa bed and still had loads of room to spare. The room includes a "kitchen area", which has a microwave, fridge, sink and coffee maker, which was a great addition as we were pretty fed up of eating in restaurants by then. The location is good, just a block from Union Square and a cable car stop. We didn't use the leisure facilities on the Club Floor, although we were given a guided tour by the very friendly staff on duty and it looked fine. The breakfast was basic and limited, but it was complimentary, so no complaints! In general, the staff throughout the hotel were helpful and friendly, which seems to be the norm in San Francisco. We loved it and would defnitely make a return trip.

review.title: if i'll go back to SF i'll take this hotel
review.reviewText: i like this hotel very much. the type of room is very good you'll feel like home. the hotel service is really good. the location of the hotel is good, just tow block from uonion squar(all the shops and resturant there) sorry for bad writing

review.title: Great Hotel in Union Square area
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised with the amenities at the Donatello. We booked directly with the hotel at AAA rate and received a continental breakfast we did not expect. Microwave, mini refrigerator, toaster and coffee maker in the room were also nice amenities. We even had a wide screen HD TV to watch the Olympics. We are sorry we could only stay one night.

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: After reading reviews following our booking, I was unsure about this hotel, however, provided that you have one of the rooms at the back this hotel offers value for money, comfort and convenience. It is very close to the main Union Square shopping, has an excellent restaurant attached, good breakfast and every one of the staff was cheerful and helpful. There is also free internet access in the lobby, althoughthis is limited to one computer.

review.title: Great except for breakfast
review.reviewText: First time in USA stayed at Donatello. Very good location and rooms were good. Breakfast consisted of danish pastries and muffins and filtered coffee - seems to be typical US food really - no-one in the US can make decent coffee and everything's processed or fried! Staff at the hotel were brilliant.

review.title: Good Hotel, Great location...
review.reviewText: Staff is helpful. Rooms good size especially for SF. Pleasant experience ... would definitely stay again...

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: hotel parking is very expensive on top of your room rate. there's no pool. breakfast isnt much more then a glorified continental breakfast.

review.title: A good place to stay
review.reviewText: Very happy with my choice of the Donatello. A large, comfortable room and very friendly staff. I'm happy to recommend the hotel as a place to stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I will go to this hotel if I visit San Francisco again. This hotel has big rooms and there is a sense of space compared to the 2 other hotels I have stayed in.

review.title: will be rejoining the same hotel cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: we had a good time everything was in walking distance. if we do it in the near future we will request the same room or the same side view

review.title: Happy Traveler
review.reviewText: My sisters have never stayed in a hotel before so I wanted to bring them to a place that was nice and still affordable. This place rocked! My sisters had a blast and the room was bigger than most studio apt. in SF! The staff was so nice and quick to our request. We felt like we received the royal treatment. Pro: Plates, silverware, and napkins provided, microwave, frig., glass cup, comfy pull out sofa (queen size!), huge breakfast, free wifi close to everything, and quick staffs. Con: May be a bit loud in the morning (those taxi drivers...grr..)

review.title: A hotel with everything you need !
review.reviewText: Great hotel indeed, quite comfortable and clean with plenty of services: free Wi-Fi internet,free complimentary BF, generous bathroom amenities and spacious suites.Enjoy drinks and listen to jazz music at Zingari every evening; friendly staff and a great location too! One dissonant note:noise from the street can be annoying; soundproofing windows would help!

review.title: A new downtown SF favorite
review.reviewText: I travel to Sf frequently on business and have stayed at many of the downtown/SOMA area hotels. The Donatello doesn't stack up with the top end of these, but is a great choice in the median price range. Wonderful location in the theater district, spacious rooms and the charm of an older establishment that's aging gracefully. The concierge level is nicely done and useful for the business traveler. Unfortunately, as is so often the case, the fitness center is an afterthought with couple of mediocre cardio machines, a shoddy universal multi-station, and a few cheap dumbbells. This may not be a consideration for most travelers, but is a perennial frustration for the frequent business guest.

review.title: Awesome hotel.
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel. The hotel staff was GREAT! We would stay there in a heart beat again. The location was perfect. The room was big and had a refig. and microwave which came in handy. The only negative was a club across the street, so stay on a top floor and bring ear plugs. It was still a 5 star. Again the staff was GREAT!

review.title: Enjoyable Stay
review.reviewText: Friendly and helpful staffs, great room, great location. Room was superb and clean. Good wi-fi service in room. Breakfast was just right.

review.title: very impressed
review.reviewText: The rooms were great. Huge. Bed and linen were comfortable. There was a king bed and a sofa with a plasma t.v. Very conveinent to the whole city. Hotel has a restaurant that was busy and good wine with mediocre food. I would stay definately again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We found a super deal thru Expedia on our hotel. Our room was on the 6th floor so it was a litlte loud with street noise at night but the beds, and even the pillow, were comfy enough to get a good night of sleep. Centrally located for access to the trolleys, buses and metro, China Town, the downtown shops. A quick ride by bus to Fisherman's Wharf. Don't forget to check out the Palace of Fine Arts - fabulous park and inside is the Exploriam. The continental breakfast was just ordinary but nice to wake up too.

review.title: Perfect no fuss location for theatre and Union Square
review.reviewText: Very convenient location for theatre and Union Square; on site parking; no fuss; more than adequate accommodations; not luxurious, but very nice;  morning "buffet" breakfast is inadequate, crowded and should be skipped

review.title: Great boutique hotel near Union Square and the Theater District
review.reviewText:
We've stayed twice at this lovely hotel. Both times our room included a chaise longue as well as a king-size bed, without feeling at all cramped.
There's a chest of drawers, as well as microwave, toaster, refrigerator, with silverware, plates and cups. 
The art is beautiful--unlike standard hotel art--and the staff is gracious and helpful.

review.title: Nice small hotel with great location.
review.reviewText: A great little European-type small hotel beginning to show its age.  Fitness facilities minimal.

review.title: One of our favorites!!
review.reviewText:
I highly recommend this hotel, so close to Union Square.
A lovely hotel,very large rooms, great service, friendly staff and their own parking garage.  Everything to suit your needs!

review.title: Good boutique hotel
review.reviewText: But could use two bath robes instead of one!
